natural_language_query: Get names of customers who placed orders in the last month
sql_query: SELECT c.name FROM customers c JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id WHERE o.order_date >= DATE_SUB(CURDATE(), INTERVAL 1 MONTH);

natural_language_query: Find products ordered more than 3 times
sql_query: SELECT p.name FROM products p JOIN (SELECT product_id, COUNT(*) as cnt FROM orders GROUP BY product_id) o ON p.product_id = o.product_id WHERE o.cnt > 3;

natural_language_query: List orders with customer names
sql_query: SELECT o.order_id, c.name, o.total_amount FROM orders o JOIN customers c ON o.customer_id = c.customer_id;

natural_language_query: List product names and total quantity sold
sql_query: SELECT p.name, SUM(oi.quantity) as total_sold FROM products p JOIN order_items oi ON p.product_id = oi.product_id GROUP BY p.name;

natural_language_query: Find products ordered more than three times
sql_query: SELECT p.name FROM products p JOIN (SELECT product_id, COUNT(*) as total FROM order_items GROUP BY product_id) x ON p.product_id = x.product_id WHERE x.total > 3;

natural_language_query: Show total sales made by each employee
sql_query: SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, SUM(o.total_amount) as total_sales FROM employees e JOIN orders o ON e.employee_id = o.employee_id GROUP BY e.employee_id;

natural_language_query: List orders with customer names
sql_query: SELECT o.order_id, c.name FROM orders o JOIN customers c ON o.customer_id = c.customer_id;

natural_language_query: Get total amount spent by each customer
sql_query: SELECT c.name, SUM(o.total_amount) AS total_spent FROM customers c JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id GROUP BY c.name;

natural_language_query: List employees and their department names
sql_query: SELECT e.name, d.department_name FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department_id;

natural_language_query: Find average total amount by customer
sql_query: SELECT customer_id, AVG(total_amount) FROM orders GROUP BY customer_id;

natural_language_query: Get the maximum and minimum total amount from orders
sql_query: SELECT MAX(total_amount) AS max_amount, MIN(total_amount) AS min_amount FROM orders;

natural_language_query: List distinct department names from employees table
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT department_name FROM departments;

natural_language_query: List top 5 highest total_amount orders
sql_query: SELECT * FROM orders ORDER BY total_amount DESC LIMIT 5;

natural_language_query: Find customers located in USA or Canada
sql_query: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE country IN ('USA', 'Canada');

natural_language_query: List orders placed between 2022-01-01 and 2022-03-31
sql_query: SELECT * FROM orders WHERE order_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-03-31';

natural_language_query: Search for employees whose name starts with 'Jo'
sql_query: SELECT * FROM employees WHERE name LIKE 'Jo%';

natural_language_query: Find customers who have more than 3 orders
sql_query: SELECT customer_id, COUNT(*) AS order_count FROM orders GROUP BY customer_id HAVING COUNT(*) > 3;

natural_language_query: Get order IDs for orders not delivered yet
sql_query: SELECT order_id FROM orders WHERE status <> 'Delivered';

natural_language_query: Select all products with price greater than average price
sql_query: SELECT * FROM products WHERE price > (SELECT AVG(price) FROM products);

natural_language_query: Create a report of employee names and their manager names
sql_query: SELECT e.name AS employee_name, m.name AS manager_name FROM employees e LEFT JOIN employees m ON e.manager_id = m.employee_id;

natural_language_query: Categorize orders as 'High' or 'Low' value based on total amount greater than 5000
sql_query: SELECT order_id, total_amount, CASE WHEN total_amount > 5000 THEN 'High' ELSE 'Low' END AS order_category FROM orders;

natural_language_query: Get the maximum salary from the employees table.
sql_query: SELECT MAX(salary) FROM employees;

natural_language_query: Find the minimum price in the products table.
sql_query: SELECT MIN(price) FROM products;

natural_language_query: Calculate the average age of users.
sql_query: SELECT AVG(age) FROM users;

natural_language_query: Find average order amount from orders table.
sql_query: SELECT AVG(total_amount) FROM orders;

natural_language_query: Get customer names and their orders using join.
sql_query: SELECT c.name, o.order_id FROM customers c JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id;

natural_language_query: List employees and their departments.
sql_query: SELECT e.name, d.name FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.dept_id = d.dept_id;

natural_language_query: Find the total revenue from sales.
sql_query: SELECT SUM(revenue) FROM sales;

natural_language_query: Calculate the sum of prices in the inventory.
sql_query: SELECT SUM(price) FROM inventory;

natural_language_query: List all products ordered by price descending.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM products ORDER BY price DESC;

sql_query: SELECT * FROM students ORDER BY marks;

sql_query: DELETE FROM employees WHERE name < 'John';

natural_language_query: Remove orders placed before '2023-01-01'
sql_query: DELETE FROM orders WHERE order_date < '2023-01-01';

natural_language_query: Show customers whose last purchase was before '2024-01-01'
sql_query: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE last_purchase < '2024-01-01';

natural_language_query: List products where price is greater than or equal to 500
sql_query: SELECT * FROM products WHERE price >= 500;

natural_language_query: Find employees whose salary is less than or equal to 30000
sql_query: SELECT * FROM employees WHERE salary <= 30000;

sql_query: UPDATE employees SET salary = 80000 WHERE name = 'Alice';

sql_query: DELETE FROM customers WHERE signup_date < '2022-06-01';

natural_language_query: Categorize employees as 'Senior' or 'Junior' based on years_of_experience > 5
sql_query: SELECT name, CASE WHEN years_of_experience > 5 THEN 'Senior' ELSE 'Junior' END AS level FROM employees;

natural_language_query: Mark orders as 'Old' if before '2023-01-01', else 'Recent'
sql_query: SELECT order_id, CASE WHEN order_date < '2023-01-01' THEN 'Old' ELSE 'Recent' END AS status FROM orders;

natural_language_query: Classify products by price: 'Premium' if > 2000, else 'Standard'
sql_query: SELECT name, CASE WHEN price > 2000 THEN 'Premium' ELSE 'Standard' END AS category FROM products;

natural_language_query: Get customers and mark as 'VIP' if total_spent > 10000
sql_query: SELECT name, CASE WHEN total_spent > 10000 THEN 'VIP' ELSE 'Regular' END AS status FROM customers;

natural_language_query: Tag employees as 'Experienced' or 'Fresher' based on years > 3
sql_query: SELECT name, CASE WHEN years > 3 THEN 'Experienced' ELSE 'Fresher' END AS experience_level FROM employees;

natural_language_query: Show total orders placed by each customer
sql_query: SELECT customer_id, COUNT(*) FROM orders GROUP BY customer_id;

natural_language_query: Get average salary for each department
sql_query: SELECT department, AVG(salary) FROM employees GROUP BY department;

natural_language_query: List count of products by category having more than 5 items
sql_query: SELECT category, COUNT(*) FROM products GROUP BY category HAVING COUNT(*) > 5;

natural_language_query: Get max order amount per customer
sql_query: SELECT customer_id, MAX(total_amount) FROM orders GROUP BY customer_id;

natural_language_query: List employees grouped by department with average age
sql_query: SELECT department, AVG(age) FROM employees GROUP BY department;

natural_language_query: Find all movies released in the year 2024.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Movies WHERE release_year = 2024;

natural_language_query: Find all movies starring 'Song Kang-ho'.
sql_query: SELECT m.* FROM Movies m JOIN MovieActors ma ON m.movie_id = ma.movie_id JOIN Actors a ON ma.actor_id = a.actor_id WHERE a.first_name = 'Song' AND a.last_name = 'Kang-ho';

natural_language_query: List movies with an average rating of 7.8 or higher.
sql_query: SELECT m.title, AVG(r.rating) as avg_rating FROM Movies m JOIN Reviews r ON m.movie_id = r.movie_id GROUP BY m.movie_id HAVING avg_rating >= 7.8;

natural_language_query: What is the average rating of movies starring 'Scarlett Johansson'?
sql_query: SELECT AVG(r.rating) FROM Reviews r JOIN MovieActors ma ON r.movie_id = ma.movie_id JOIN Actors a ON ma.actor_id = a.actor_id WHERE a.first_name = 'Scarlett' AND a.last_name = 'Johansson';

natural_language_query: What is the average runtime of 'Animation' movies?
sql_query: SELECT AVG(m.runtime_minutes) FROM Movies m JOIN MovieGenres mg ON m.movie_id = mg.movie_id JOIN Genres g ON mg.genre_id = g.genre_id WHERE g.name = 'Animation';

natural_language_query: Which director has the highest average movie rating?
sql_query: SELECT d.first_name, d.last_name, AVG(r.rating) as avg_director_rating FROM Directors d JOIN Movies m ON d.director_id = m.director_id JOIN Reviews r ON m.movie_id = r.movie_id GROUP BY d.director_id ORDER BY avg_director_rating DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Find the main actors of 'The Irishman'.
sql_query: SELECT a.first_name, a.last_name FROM Actors a JOIN MovieActors ma ON a.actor_id = ma.actor_id JOIN Movies m ON ma.movie_id = m.movie_id WHERE m.title = 'The Irishman';

natural_language_query: List all movies produced in the 'UK'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Movies WHERE country_of_origin = 'UK';

natural_language_query: Which actor has appeared in the most movies?
sql_query: SELECT a.first_name, a.last_name, COUNT(ma.movie_id) AS movie_count FROM Actors a JOIN MovieActors ma ON a.actor_id = ma.actor_id GROUP BY a.actor_id ORDER BY movie_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Find the top 5 highest-rated movies.
sql_query: SELECT m.title, AVG(r.rating) as avg_rating FROM Movies m JOIN Reviews r ON m.movie_id = r.movie_id GROUP BY m.movie_id ORDER BY avg_rating DESC LIMIT 5;

natural_language_query: List movies with an average rating of 7.0 or higher.

natural_language_query: Find movies starring 'Scarlett Johansson' and directed by 'Christopher Nolan'.

natural_language_query: List movies with an average rating of 9.0 or higher.

natural_language_query: List the top 5 members who have borrowed the most books.
sql_query: SELECT m.first_name, m.last_name, COUNT(l.loan_id) as loan_count FROM Members m JOIN Loans l ON m.member_id = l.member_id GROUP BY m.member_id ORDER BY loan_count DESC LIMIT 5;

natural_language_query: How many authors are of 'American' nationality?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Authors WHERE nationality = 'American';

natural_language_query: How many books were written by 'J.R.R. Tolkien'?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Books WHERE author_id = (SELECT author_id FROM Authors WHERE first_name = 'J.R.R.' AND last_name = 'Tolkien');

natural_language_query: List all books added to the library in the year 2024.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Books WHERE strftime('%Y', date_added) = '2024';

natural_language_query: Log a new loan: book ID 911 to member ID 261 on 2022-03-04.
sql_query: INSERT INTO Loans (book_id, member_id, loan_date, due_date) VALUES (911, 261, '2022-03-04', '2025-05-29');

natural_language_query: What is the average number of books borrowed per month?
sql_query: SELECT AVG(monthly_loans) FROM (SELECT COUNT(*) as monthly_loans FROM Loans GROUP BY strftime('%Y-%m', loan_date));

natural_language_query: List the borrowing history for member ID 440.
sql_query: SELECT b.title, l.loan_date, l.return_date FROM Loans l JOIN Books b ON l.book_id = b.book_id WHERE l.member_id = 440;

natural_language_query: How many authors are of 'Russian' nationality?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Authors WHERE nationality = 'Russian';

natural_language_query: Find the most borrowed book.
sql_query: SELECT b.title, COUNT(l.loan_id) as loan_count FROM Books b JOIN Loans l ON b.book_id = l.book_id GROUP BY b.book_id ORDER BY loan_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Search for books with 'AJzusr' in the title.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Books WHERE title LIKE '%AJzusr%';

natural_language_query: Find books with an average rating of 3 stars or higher.
sql_query: SELECT b.title, AVG(r.rating) as avg_rating FROM Books b JOIN Reviews r ON b.book_id = r.book_id GROUP BY b.book_id HAVING avg_rating >= 3;

natural_language_query: Find books with an average rating of 4 stars or higher.
sql_query: SELECT b.title, AVG(r.rating) as avg_rating FROM Books b JOIN Reviews r ON b.book_id = r.book_id GROUP BY b.book_id HAVING avg_rating >= 4;

natural_language_query: Find the member who has been with the library the longest.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Members ORDER BY join_date ASC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Add a new book: 'Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone', author ID 8, genre 'Fantasy', published in 1883, ISBN 978-1-9981-2895-2.
sql_query: INSERT INTO Books (title, author_id, genre, publication_year, isbn) VALUES ('Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone', 8, 'Fantasy', 1883, '978-1-9981-2895-2');

natural_language_query: Search for books with 'y1xDgL' in the title.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Books WHERE title LIKE '%y1xDgL%';

natural_language_query: Add a new book: 'It', author ID 3, genre 'Science Fiction', published in 1848, ISBN 978-1-4035-2475-9.
sql_query: INSERT INTO Books (title, author_id, genre, publication_year, isbn) VALUES ('It', 3, 'Science Fiction', 1848, '978-1-4035-2475-9');

natural_language_query: List all members who have overdue books.
sql_query: SELECT m.* FROM Members m JOIN Loans l ON m.member_id = l.member_id WHERE l.return_date IS NULL AND l.due_date < CURRENT_DATE;

natural_language_query: Find members who have not borrowed any books.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Members WHERE member_id NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT member_id FROM Loans);

natural_language_query: How many books were written by 'Stephen King'?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Books WHERE author_id = (SELECT author_id FROM Authors WHERE first_name = 'Stephen' AND last_name = 'King');

natural_language_query: List all books published before 1903.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Books WHERE publication_year < 1903;

natural_language_query: List all overdue books and calculate the fine at a rate of $0.78 per day.
sql_query: SELECT b.title, m.first_name, m.last_name, (CURRENT_DATE - l.due_date) * 0.78 AS fine_amount FROM Books b JOIN Loans l ON b.book_id = l.book_id JOIN Members m ON l.member_id = m.member_id WHERE l.return_date IS NULL AND l.due_date < CURRENT_DATE;

natural_language_query: Add a new author: 'J.K. Rowling' from 'Japanese'.
sql_query: INSERT INTO Authors (first_name, last_name, nationality) VALUES ('J.K.', 'Rowling', 'Japanese');

natural_language_query: Find all books in the 'Biography' genre.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Books WHERE genre = 'Biography';

natural_language_query: List all overdue books and calculate the fine at a rate of $0.29 per day.
sql_query: SELECT b.title, m.first_name, m.last_name, (CURRENT_DATE - l.due_date) * 0.29 AS fine_amount FROM Books b JOIN Loans l ON b.book_id = l.book_id JOIN Members m ON l.member_id = m.member_id WHERE l.return_date IS NULL AND l.due_date < CURRENT_DATE;

natural_language_query: Add a new book: 'Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone', author ID 8, genre 'Non-Fiction', published in 1872, ISBN 978-7-2859-7183-8.
sql_query: INSERT INTO Books (title, author_id, genre, publication_year, isbn) VALUES ('Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone', 8, 'Non-Fiction', 1872, '978-7-2859-7183-8');

natural_language_query: Search for books with 'PvSNzp' in the title.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Books WHERE title LIKE '%PvSNzp%';

natural_language_query: Search for books with 'Tdra0o' in the title.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Books WHERE title LIKE '%Tdra0o%';

natural_language_query: What is the most popular genre (most borrowed)?
sql_query: SELECT b.genre, COUNT(l.loan_id) as loan_count FROM Books b JOIN Loans l ON b.book_id = l.book_id GROUP BY b.genre ORDER BY loan_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Calculate the total fine for member ID 150.
sql_query: SELECT SUM(fine_amount) FROM Loans WHERE member_id = 150;

natural_language_query: List all overdue books and calculate the fine at a rate of $0.45 per day.
sql_query: SELECT b.title, m.first_name, m.last_name, (CURRENT_DATE - l.due_date) * 0.45 AS fine_amount FROM Books b JOIN Loans l ON b.book_id = l.book_id JOIN Members m ON l.member_id = m.member_id WHERE l.return_date IS NULL AND l.due_date < CURRENT_DATE;

natural_language_query: Find all members with outstanding fines.
sql_query: SELECT m.*, l.fine_amount FROM Members m JOIN Loans l ON m.member_id = l.member_id WHERE l.return_date IS NULL AND l.due_date < CURRENT_DATE;

natural_language_query: List all overdue books and calculate the fine at a rate of $0.68 per day.
sql_query: SELECT b.title, m.first_name, m.last_name, (CURRENT_DATE - l.due_date) * 0.68 AS fine_amount FROM Books b JOIN Loans l ON b.book_id = l.book_id JOIN Members m ON l.member_id = m.member_id WHERE l.return_date IS NULL AND l.due_date < CURRENT_DATE;

natural_language_query: Which author has written the most books in the 'Thriller' genre?
sql_query: SELECT a.first_name, a.last_name, COUNT(b.book_id) as book_count FROM Authors a JOIN Books b ON a.author_id = b.author_id WHERE b.genre = 'Thriller' GROUP BY a.author_id ORDER BY book_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: List all overdue books and calculate the fine at a rate of $0.23 per day.
sql_query: SELECT b.title, m.first_name, m.last_name, (CURRENT_DATE - l.due_date) * 0.23 AS fine_amount FROM Books b JOIN Loans l ON b.book_id = l.book_id JOIN Members m ON l.member_id = m.member_id WHERE l.return_date IS NULL AND l.due_date < CURRENT_DATE;

natural_language_query: List all overdue books and calculate the fine at a rate of $0.18 per day.
sql_query: SELECT b.title, m.first_name, m.last_name, (CURRENT_DATE - l.due_date) * 0.18 AS fine_amount FROM Books b JOIN Loans l ON b.book_id = l.book_id JOIN Members m ON l.member_id = m.member_id WHERE l.return_date IS NULL AND l.due_date < CURRENT_DATE;

natural_language_query: Find all aircraft manufactured by 'Boeing'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Aircrafts WHERE manufacturer = 'Boeing';

natural_language_query: List all flights scheduled to depart from 'JFK' and arrive at 'LAX'.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number, al.name AS airline, a.model AS aircraft_model FROM Flights f JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id JOIN Airlines al ON f.airline_id = al.airline_id JOIN Aircrafts a ON f.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id WHERE dep.iata_code = 'JFK' AND arr.iata_code = 'LAX';

natural_language_query: Count the number of flights operated by each airline.
sql_query: SELECT al.name, COUNT(f.flight_id) AS number_of_flights FROM Airlines al JOIN Flights f ON al.airline_id = f.airline_id GROUP BY al.name ORDER BY number_of_flights DESC;

natural_language_query: Find the top 5 airports with the most departures.
sql_query: SELECT ap.name, COUNT(f.flight_id) AS departure_count FROM Airports ap JOIN Flights f ON ap.airport_id = f.departure_airport_id GROUP BY ap.name ORDER BY departure_count DESC LIMIT 5;

natural_language_query: Update the status of flight 'UA456' to 'Delayed'.
sql_query: UPDATE Flights SET status = 'Delayed' WHERE flight_number = 'UA456';

natural_language_query: Add a new aircraft, a 'Boeing 787' with a capacity of 290, to the database.
sql_query: INSERT INTO Aircrafts (model, manufacturer, capacity, range_km) VALUES ('787 Dreamliner', 'Boeing', 290, 14140);

natural_language_query: Delete all flights with the status 'Cancelled'.
sql_query: DELETE FROM Flights WHERE status = 'Cancelled';

natural_language_query: Find all aircraft that have undergone maintenance in the last year.
sql_query: SELECT a.model, a.manufacturer, m.maintenance_date, m.description FROM Aircrafts a JOIN Maintenance m ON a.aircraft_id = m.aircraft_id WHERE m.maintenance_date >= DATE('now', '-1 year');

natural_language_query: List all passengers on flight 'DL123'.
sql_query: SELECT p.first_name, p.last_name, b.seat_number FROM Passengers p JOIN Bookings b ON p.passenger_id = b.passenger_id JOIN Flights f ON b.flight_id = f.flight_id WHERE f.flight_number = 'DL123';

natural_language_query: Add a new 'on_time_percentage' column to the Airlines table.
sql_query: ALTER TABLE Airlines ADD COLUMN on_time_percentage DECIMAL(5, 2);

natural_language_query: Calculate the average flight duration for flights between 'SFO' and 'ORD'.
sql_query: SELECT AVG(strftime('%s', arrival_time) - strftime('%s', departure_time)) / 60 AS avg_duration_minutes FROM Flights f JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id WHERE dep.iata_code = 'SFO' AND arr.iata_code = 'ORD';

natural_language_query: Find the airline with the most diverse fleet of aircraft models.
sql_query: SELECT al.name, COUNT(DISTINCT a.model) AS unique_aircraft_models FROM Airlines al JOIN Flights f ON al.airline_id = f.airline_id JOIN Aircrafts a ON f.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id GROUP BY al.name ORDER BY unique_aircraft_models DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Create a new 'Crews' table to assign staff to flights.
sql_query: CREATE TABLE Crews (crew_id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY, flight_id INTEGER, pilot_name VARCHAR(255), copilot_name VARCHAR(255), FOREIGN KEY(flight_id) REFERENCES Flights(flight_id));

natural_language_query: Rank airlines based on the average capacity of their aircraft.
sql_query: SELECT al.name, AVG(ac.capacity) AS avg_capacity, RANK() OVER (ORDER BY AVG(ac.capacity) DESC) as capacity_rank FROM Airlines al JOIN Flights f ON al.airline_id = f.airline_id JOIN Aircrafts ac ON f.aircraft_id = ac.aircraft_id GROUP BY al.name;

natural_language_query: Update the range of all 'Airbus A320' aircraft to 6200 km.
sql_query: UPDATE Aircrafts SET range_km = 6200 WHERE model = 'A320' AND manufacturer = 'Airbus';

natural_language_query: Show all flights that are currently 'In Air'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE status = 'In Air';

natural_language_query: List all airports located in 'Germany'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airports WHERE country = 'Germany';

natural_language_query: Find the total number of seats available across all of United Airlines' aircraft.
sql_query: SELECT SUM(a.capacity) FROM Aircrafts a JOIN Airlines al ON a.airline_id = al.airline_id WHERE al.name = 'United Airlines';

natural_language_query: Which aircraft has the longest range?
sql_query: SELECT model, manufacturer, range_km FROM Aircrafts ORDER BY range_km DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: How many flights are scheduled for tomorrow?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Flights WHERE DATE(departure_time) = DATE('now', '+1 day');

natural_language_query: List all flights that have been delayed for more than 2 hours.
sql_query: SELECT flight_number, departure_time, arrival_time FROM Flights WHERE status = 'Delayed' AND (strftime('%s', arrival_time) - strftime('%s', scheduled_arrival_time)) > 7200;

natural_language_query: What is the average passenger capacity of an Airbus aircraft?
sql_query: SELECT AVG(capacity) FROM Aircrafts WHERE manufacturer = 'Airbus';

natural_language_query: Find all maintenance records for aircraft 'N12345'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Maintenance WHERE aircraft_id = (SELECT aircraft_id FROM Aircrafts WHERE registration = 'N12345');

natural_language_query: Which pilot has flown the most flights?
sql_query: SELECT pilot_name, COUNT(*) as flight_count FROM Crews GROUP BY pilot_name ORDER BY flight_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: List all flights going to 'London'.
sql_query: SELECT f.* FROM Flights f JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id WHERE arr.city = 'London';

natural_language_query: Add a 'registration' column to the Aircrafts table and make it unique.
sql_query: ALTER TABLE Aircrafts ADD COLUMN registration VARCHAR(10) UNIQUE;

natural_language_query: Find the busiest route in the database.
sql_query: SELECT dep.name, arr.name, COUNT(*) as flight_count FROM Flights f JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id GROUP BY dep.name, arr.name ORDER BY flight_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Delete all bookings for flight 'BA2492'.
sql_query: DELETE FROM Bookings WHERE flight_id = (SELECT flight_id FROM Flights WHERE flight_number = 'BA2492');

natural_language_query: Show the flight details for flight number 'AA100'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights f JOIN Airlines al ON f.airline_id = al.airline_id JOIN Aircrafts a ON f.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id WHERE f.flight_number = 'AA100';

natural_language_query: Find the top 3 airlines with the highest on-time percentage.
sql_query: SELECT name, on_time_percentage FROM Airlines ORDER BY on_time_percentage DESC LIMIT 3;

natural_language_query: List all aircraft that have a capacity of more than 300 passengers.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Aircrafts WHERE capacity > 300;

natural_language_query: How many airports are there in 'China'?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Airports WHERE country = 'China';

natural_language_query: What is the shortest flight duration between any two airports?
sql_query: SELECT MIN(strftime('%s', arrival_time) - strftime('%s', departure_time)) / 60 AS min_duration_minutes FROM Flights;

natural_language_query: Update the airline for flight 'AF1780' to 'Air France'.
sql_query: UPDATE Flights SET airline_id = (SELECT airline_id FROM Airlines WHERE name = 'Air France') WHERE flight_number = 'AF1780';

natural_language_query: Find all flights departing in the next 3 hours.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE departure_time BETWEEN DATETIME('now') AND DATETIME('now', '+3 hours');

natural_language_query: List all passengers with the last name 'Smith'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Passengers WHERE last_name = 'Smith';

natural_language_query: Create an index on the 'flight_number' column in the Flights table.
sql_query: CREATE INDEX idx_flight_number ON Flights(flight_number);

natural_language_query: Find the number of available seats on flight 'EK201'.
sql_query: SELECT a.capacity - COUNT(b.booking_id) AS available_seats FROM Flights f JOIN Aircrafts a ON f.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id LEFT JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id WHERE f.flight_number = 'EK201' GROUP BY a.capacity;

natural_language_query: Which country has the most airports?
sql_query: SELECT country, COUNT(*) as airport_count FROM Airports GROUP BY country ORDER BY airport_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Show all flights that use a 'Boeing 777'.
sql_query: SELECT f.* FROM Flights f JOIN Aircrafts a ON f.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id WHERE a.model = '777' AND a.manufacturer = 'Boeing';

natural_language_query: List all airlines that do not have any flights scheduled.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airlines WHERE airline_id NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT airline_id FROM Flights);

natural_language_query: Find the average number of flights per day.
sql_query: SELECT AVG(flights_per_day) FROM (SELECT COUNT(*) as flights_per_day FROM Flights GROUP BY DATE(departure_time));

natural_language_query: Change the pilot for flight 'LH992' to 'Klaus Schmidt'.
sql_query: UPDATE Crews SET pilot_name = 'Klaus Schmidt' WHERE flight_id = (SELECT flight_id FROM Flights WHERE flight_number = 'LH992');

natural_language_query: What percentage of flights are delayed?
sql_query: SELECT (COUNT(CASE WHEN status = 'Delayed' THEN 1 END) * 100.0) / COUNT(*) FROM Flights;

natural_language_query: List all flights from 'Paris' to 'New York'.
sql_query: SELECT f.* FROM Flights f JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id WHERE dep.city = 'Paris' AND arr.city = 'New York';

natural_language_query: Find the aircraft that has had the most maintenance checks.
sql_query: SELECT a.model, a.manufacturer, COUNT(m.maintenance_id) as maintenance_count FROM Aircrafts a JOIN Maintenance m ON a.aircraft_id = m.aircraft_id GROUP BY a.model, a.manufacturer ORDER BY maintenance_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Add a check constraint to ensure aircraft capacity is positive.
sql_query: ALTER TABLE Aircrafts ADD CONSTRAINT check_capacity_positive CHECK (capacity > 0);

natural_language_query: Drop the 'Crews' table.
sql_query: DROP TABLE Crews;

natural_language_query: Show all flights between 8 AM and 12 PM today.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE DATE(departure_time) = DATE('now') AND STRFTIME('%H', departure_time) BETWEEN '08' AND '11';

natural_language_query: Find all passengers who have booked more than 5 flights.
sql_query: SELECT p.first_name, p.last_name, COUNT(b.booking_id) as booking_count FROM Passengers p JOIN Bookings b ON p.passenger_id = b.passenger_id GROUP BY p.passenger_id HAVING booking_count > 5;

natural_language_query: List all flights that are longer than 10 hours.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE (strftime('%s', arrival_time) - strftime('%s', departure_time)) > 36000;

natural_language_query: Which airline operates the flight 'QF2'?
sql_query: SELECT al.name FROM Airlines al JOIN Flights f ON al.airline_id = f.airline_id WHERE f.flight_number = 'QF2';

natural_language_query: Update the city of airport 'LHR' to 'London'.
sql_query: UPDATE Airports SET city = 'London' WHERE iata_code = 'LHR';

natural_language_query: Find the second busiest airport for arrivals.
sql_query: SELECT ap.name, COUNT(f.flight_id) AS arrival_count FROM Airports ap JOIN Flights f ON ap.airport_id = f.arrival_airport_id GROUP BY ap.name ORDER BY arrival_count DESC LIMIT 1 OFFSET 1;

natural_language_query: List all aircraft manufactured by 'Airbus' with a capacity between 150 and 250.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Aircrafts WHERE manufacturer = 'Airbus' AND capacity BETWEEN 150 AND 250;

natural_language_query: How many flights are there from 'DXB' to 'LHR' each week?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*)/4.0 as avg_weekly_flights FROM Flights f JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id WHERE dep.iata_code = 'DXB' AND arr.iata_code = 'LHR' AND f.departure_time >= DATE('now', '-28 days');

natural_language_query: Find all flights that do not have a co-pilot assigned.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Crews c ON f.flight_id = c.flight_id WHERE c.copilot_name IS NULL;

natural_language_query: Add a new passenger 'John Doe'.
sql_query: INSERT INTO Passengers (first_name, last_name) VALUES ('John', 'Doe');

natural_language_query: List the next 5 departures from airport 'ATL'.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number, f.departure_time, arr.name as destination FROM Flights f JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id WHERE f.departure_airport_id = (SELECT airport_id FROM Airports WHERE iata_code = 'ATL') AND f.departure_time > DATETIME('now') ORDER BY f.departure_time ASC LIMIT 5;

natural_language_query: What is the total number of passengers that can be transported at once by 'Lufthansa'?
sql_query: WITH AirlineAircraft AS (SELECT DISTINCT aircraft_id FROM Flights WHERE airline_id = (SELECT airline_id FROM Airlines WHERE name = 'Lufthansa')) SELECT SUM(a.capacity) FROM Aircrafts a JOIN AirlineAircraft aa ON a.aircraft_id = aa.aircraft_id;

natural_language_query: Find all flights with a duration between 2 and 4 hours.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE (strftime('%s', arrival_time) - strftime('%s', departure_time)) BETWEEN 7200 AND 14400;

natural_language_query: List all unique aircraft models in the database.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT model, manufacturer FROM Aircrafts;

natural_language_query: Change the status of all flights departing before today to 'Completed'.
sql_query: UPDATE Flights SET status = 'Completed' WHERE DATE(departure_time) < DATE('now');

natural_language_query: How many different countries does 'Emirates' fly to?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT arr.country) FROM Flights f JOIN Airlines al ON f.airline_id = al.airline_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id WHERE al.name = 'Emirates';

natural_language_query: Find the flight with the most bookings.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number, COUNT(b.booking_id) as booking_count FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id GROUP BY f.flight_number ORDER BY booking_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: List all pilots whose names start with 'J'.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT pilot_name FROM Crews WHERE pilot_name LIKE 'J%';

natural_language_query: Create a view that shows comprehensive flight information.
sql_query: CREATE VIEW FlightDetails AS SELECT f.flight_number, al.name as airline, dep.name as departure_airport, arr.name as arrival_airport, f.departure_time, f.arrival_time, a.model as aircraft_model, f.status FROM Flights f JOIN Airlines al ON f.airline_id = al.airline_id JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id JOIN Aircrafts a ON f.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id;

natural_language_query: Find the oldest aircraft in the fleet.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Aircrafts ORDER BY manufacturing_year ASC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Delete passengers who have no bookings.
sql_query: DELETE FROM Passengers WHERE passenger_id NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT passenger_id FROM Bookings);

natural_language_query: Show the number of flights for each day of the week.
sql_query: SELECT STRFTIME('%w', departure_time) as day_of_week, COUNT(*) as flight_count FROM Flights GROUP BY day_of_week ORDER BY day_of_week;

natural_language_query: List all airports with 'International' in their name.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airports WHERE name LIKE '%International%';

natural_language_query: Find the average delay time for flights in minutes.
sql_query: SELECT AVG((strftime('%s', arrival_time) - strftime('%s', scheduled_arrival_time)) / 60) FROM Flights WHERE status = 'Delayed';

natural_language_query: Update the capacity of all 'Boeing 737' aircraft to 180.
sql_query: UPDATE Aircrafts SET capacity = 180 WHERE model = '737' AND manufacturer = 'Boeing';

natural_language_query: Which flights are scheduled on Christmas Day?
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE STRFTIME('%m-%d', departure_time) = '12-25';

natural_language_query: Find the total number of bookings made.
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Bookings;

natural_language_query: List all flights operated by Star Alliance members.
sql_query: SELECT f.* FROM Flights f JOIN Airlines al ON f.airline_id = al.airline_id WHERE al.alliance = 'Star Alliance';

natural_language_query: Find the passenger who has traveled the furthest distance.
sql_query: SELECT p.first_name, p.last_name, SUM(r.distance_km) as total_distance FROM Passengers p JOIN Bookings b ON p.passenger_id = b.passenger_id JOIN Flights f ON b.flight_id = f.flight_id JOIN Routes r ON f.route_id = r.route_id GROUP BY p.passenger_id ORDER BY total_distance DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Add a default status of 'Scheduled' to the Flights table.
sql_query: ALTER TABLE Flights ALTER COLUMN status SET DEFAULT 'Scheduled';

natural_language_query: List all flights that have been rerouted.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE original_arrival_airport_id IS NOT NULL AND original_arrival_airport_id != arrival_airport_id;

natural_language_query: How many aircraft does 'Delta Air Lines' operate?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT aircraft_id) FROM Flights WHERE airline_id = (SELECT airline_id FROM Airlines WHERE name = 'Delta Air Lines');

natural_language_query: Find the most common aircraft model in use.
sql_query: SELECT a.model, a.manufacturer, COUNT(*) as flight_count FROM Flights f JOIN Aircrafts a ON f.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id GROUP BY a.model, a.manufacturer ORDER BY flight_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Show the full name of the pilot and copilot for flight 'SQ321'.
sql_query: SELECT pilot_name, copilot_name FROM Crews WHERE flight_id = (SELECT flight_id FROM Flights WHERE flight_number = 'SQ321');

natural_language_query: List all flights departing from 'SFO' and their gate numbers.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number, g.gate_number FROM Flights f JOIN Gates g ON f.gate_id = g.gate_id WHERE f.departure_airport_id = (SELECT airport_id FROM Airports WHERE iata_code = 'SFO');

natural_language_query: Find the percentage of seats filled for each flight.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number, (COUNT(b.booking_id) * 100.0) / a.capacity as occupancy_percentage FROM Flights f JOIN Aircrafts a ON f.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id LEFT JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id GROUP BY f.flight_number, a.capacity;

natural_language_query: Rename the 'range_km' column in Aircrafts to 'max_range_km'.
sql_query: ALTER TABLE Aircrafts RENAME COLUMN range_km TO max_range_km;

natural_language_query: Find all flights to 'Tokyo' that use an 'Airbus A380'.
sql_query: SELECT f.* FROM Flights f JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id JOIN Aircrafts a ON f.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id WHERE arr.city = 'Tokyo' AND a.model = 'A380' AND a.manufacturer = 'Airbus';

natural_language_query: List all maintenance activities that involved an 'engine check'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Maintenance WHERE description LIKE '%engine check%';

natural_language_query: What is the average number of passengers on a flight from 'LAX' to 'JFK'?
sql_query: SELECT AVG(pax_count) FROM (SELECT COUNT(b.booking_id) as pax_count FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id WHERE dep.iata_code = 'LAX' AND arr.iata_code = 'JFK' GROUP BY f.flight_id);

natural_language_query: Cancel all flights to 'MIA' due to a hurricane.
sql_query: UPDATE Flights SET status = 'Cancelled' WHERE arrival_airport_id = (SELECT airport_id FROM Airports WHERE iata_code = 'MIA') AND DATE(departure_time) = DATE('now');

natural_language_query: Find the top 5 longest domestic flights in the USA.
sql_query: SELECT dep.name, arr.name, r.distance_km FROM Routes r JOIN Airports dep ON r.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON r.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id WHERE dep.country = 'USA' AND arr.country = 'USA' ORDER BY r.distance_km DESC LIMIT 5;

natural_language_query: List all flights with a connection time of less than 45 minutes.
sql_query: SELECT f1.flight_number as first_leg, f2.flight_number as second_leg, (strftime('%s', f2.departure_time) - strftime('%s', f1.arrival_time))/60 as connection_minutes FROM Flights f1 JOIN Flights f2 ON f1.arrival_airport_id = f2.departure_airport_id WHERE connection_minutes < 45;

natural_language_query: Show the hierarchy of employees in the airline.
sql_query: WITH RECURSIVE EmployeeHierarchy (employee_id, name, manager_id, level) AS (SELECT employee_id, name, manager_id, 0 FROM Employees WHERE manager_id IS NULL UNION ALL SELECT e.employee_id, e.name, e.manager_id, eh.level + 1 FROM Employees e JOIN EmployeeHierarchy eh ON e.manager_id = eh.employee_id) SELECT * FROM EmployeeHierarchy;

natural_language_query: Find all aircraft that have not had maintenance in over 2 years.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Aircrafts a WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM Maintenance m WHERE m.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id AND m.maintenance_date > DATE('now', '-2 years'));

natural_language_query: Calculate the running total of flights per month.
sql_query: SELECT STRFTIME('%Y-%m', departure_time) as month, COUNT(*) as monthly_flights, SUM(COUNT(*)) OVER (ORDER BY STRFTIME('%Y-%m', departure_time)) as running_total FROM Flights GROUP BY month;

natural_language_query: Find the most profitable route.
sql_query: SELECT r.name, SUM(t.price) - SUM(c.cost) as profit FROM Routes r JOIN Flights f ON r.route_id = f.route_id JOIN Tickets t ON f.flight_id = t.flight_id JOIN Costs c ON f.flight_id = c.flight_id GROUP BY r.name ORDER BY profit DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: List all flights that have flown over the Arctic Circle.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE flight_path && ST_MakeEnvelope(-180, 66.5, 180, 90);

natural_language_query: For each airline, find the flight with the longest delay.
sql_query: WITH RankedDelays AS (SELECT f.flight_number, al.name as airline_name, (strftime('%s', f.arrival_time) - strftime('%s', f.scheduled_arrival_time)) as delay, RANK() OVER (PARTITION BY al.name ORDER BY (strftime('%s', f.arrival_time) - strftime('%s', f.scheduled_arrival_time)) DESC) as rnk FROM Flights f JOIN Airlines al ON f.airline_id = al.airline_id WHERE f.status = 'Delayed') SELECT flight_number, airline_name, delay FROM RankedDelays WHERE rnk = 1;

natural_language_query: Identify flights that might be late based on current weather conditions.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Weather w ON dep.iata_code = w.airport_code WHERE w.conditions IN ('Heavy Snow', 'Thunderstorm') AND f.status = 'Scheduled';

natural_language_query: Cluster airports into 5 groups based on their geographic location.
sql_query: SELECT name, ST_ClusterKMeans(location, 5) OVER() as cluster_id FROM Airports;

natural_language_query: Find the 'center of mass' for all of an airline's routes.
sql_query: SELECT ST_Centroid(ST_Collect(r.path)) FROM Routes r JOIN Flights f ON r.route_id = f.route_id JOIN Airlines al ON f.airline_id = al.airline_id WHERE al.name = 'Southwest Airlines';

natural_language_query: List the previous and next flight for each flight on a specific route.
sql_query: SELECT flight_number, LAG(flight_number, 1) OVER (ORDER BY departure_time) as previous_flight, LEAD(flight_number, 1) OVER (ORDER BY departure_time) as next_flight FROM Flights WHERE route_id = 123;

natural_language_query: Categorize flights by duration: Short (<3h), Medium (3-6h), Long (>6h).
sql_query: SELECT flight_number, CASE WHEN (strftime('%s', arrival_time) - strftime('%s', departure_time)) < 10800 THEN 'Short' WHEN (strftime('%s', arrival_time) - strftime('%s', departure_time)) BETWEEN 10800 AND 21600 THEN 'Medium' ELSE 'Long' END as duration_category FROM Flights;

natural_language_query: Find all circular routes (departure and arrival airport are the same).
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE departure_airport_id = arrival_airport_id;

natural_language_query: Calculate the Gini coefficient for flight delays to measure inequality.
sql_query: SELECT (1.0 / (2.0 * COUNT(*) * AVG(delay))) * SUM(ABS(d1.delay - d2.delay)) FROM Delays d1, Delays d2;

natural_language_query: Find the optimal gate assignment to minimize passenger walking distance.
sql_query: WITH GateDistances AS (...) SELECT * FROM min_cost_max_flow(...) ;

natural_language_query: Predict the probability of a flight being delayed using a logistic regression model.
sql_query: SELECT PREDICT(delay_model, f.departure_time, r.distance_km, w.temperature) FROM Flights f JOIN Routes r ON f.route_id = r.route_id JOIN Weather w ON f.departure_airport_id = w.airport_id;

natural_language_query: Show me all flights from 'CDG' to 'JFK' on 'Air France'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights f JOIN Airlines al ON f.airline_id = al.airline_id JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id WHERE dep.iata_code = 'CDG' AND arr.iata_code = 'JFK' AND al.name = 'Air France';

natural_language_query: What is the total number of airports in the database?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Airports;

natural_language_query: Find all aircraft with a range greater than 15000 km.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Aircrafts WHERE range_km > 15000;

natural_language_query: List all flights that depart on a Monday.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE STRFTIME('%w', departure_time) = '1';

natural_language_query: How many passengers are on flight 'EK202'?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Bookings WHERE flight_id = (SELECT flight_id FROM Flights WHERE flight_number = 'EK202');

natural_language_query: Update the manufacturing year of aircraft 'N98765' to 2018.
sql_query: UPDATE Aircrafts SET manufacturing_year = 2018 WHERE registration = 'N98765';

natural_language_query: Find the airline that operates the most flights from 'LAX'.
sql_query: SELECT al.name, COUNT(*) as flight_count FROM Flights f JOIN Airlines al ON f.airline_id = al.airline_id WHERE f.departure_airport_id = (SELECT airport_id FROM Airports WHERE iata_code = 'LAX') GROUP BY al.name ORDER BY flight_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Delete all maintenance records older than 10 years.
sql_query: DELETE FROM Maintenance WHERE maintenance_date < DATE('now', '-10 years');

natural_language_query: List all flights to 'Singapore' from 'India'.
sql_query: SELECT f.* FROM Flights f JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id WHERE dep.country = 'India' AND arr.city = 'Singapore';

natural_language_query: What is the average number of crew members on a flight?
sql_query: SELECT AVG(pilot_count + copilot_count + cabin_crew_count) FROM Crews;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have been assigned a gate in terminal '4'.
sql_query: SELECT f.* FROM Flights f JOIN Gates g ON f.gate_id = g.gate_id WHERE g.terminal = '4';

natural_language_query: Add a new airport 'BER' for Berlin Brandenburg Airport.
sql_query: INSERT INTO Airports (name, iata_code, icao_code, city, country, latitude, longitude) VALUES ('Berlin Brandenburg Airport', 'BER', 'EDDB', 'Berlin', 'Germany', 52.3667, 13.5033);

natural_language_query: List all passengers who have a booking but no assigned seat.
sql_query: SELECT p.* FROM Passengers p JOIN Bookings b ON p.passenger_id = b.passenger_id WHERE b.seat_number IS NULL;

natural_language_query: Find the total distance of all flights operated by 'Qantas'.
sql_query: SELECT SUM(r.distance_km) FROM Flights f JOIN Routes r ON f.route_id = r.route_id JOIN Airlines al ON f.airline_id = al.airline_id WHERE al.name = 'Qantas';

natural_language_query: Change the ICAO code for 'JFK' to 'KJFK'.
sql_query: UPDATE Airports SET icao_code = 'KJFK' WHERE iata_code = 'JFK';

natural_language_query: Show the top 10 longest flights by duration.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number, (strftime('%s', f.arrival_time) - strftime('%s', f.departure_time))/3600.0 as duration_hours FROM Flights f ORDER BY duration_hours DESC LIMIT 10;

natural_language_query: How many unique routes does the database contain?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Routes;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that are part of a codeshare agreement.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE is_codeshare = 1;

natural_language_query: List all aircraft that have never been used on a flight.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Aircrafts WHERE aircraft_id NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT aircraft_id FROM Flights);

natural_language_query: What is the most frequent departure time for flights?
sql_query: SELECT STRFTIME('%H:%M', departure_time) as time, COUNT(*) as freq FROM Flights GROUP BY time ORDER BY freq DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the alliance for 'American Airlines' to 'Oneworld'.
sql_query: UPDATE Airlines SET alliance = 'Oneworld' WHERE name = 'American Airlines';

natural_language_query: Find the number of flights per airline per day.
sql_query: SELECT al.name, DATE(f.departure_time) as flight_date, COUNT(*) as flight_count FROM Flights f JOIN Airlines al ON f.airline_id = al.airline_id GROUP BY al.name, flight_date;

natural_language_query: List all passengers who are flying to a different country than their own.
sql_query: SELECT p.* FROM Passengers p JOIN Bookings b ON p.passenger_id = b.passenger_id JOIN Flights f ON b.flight_id = f.flight_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id WHERE p.nationality != arr.country;

natural_language_query: Create a trigger that updates a flight's status to 'Departed' when the departure time is passed.
sql_query: CREATE TRIGGER update_flight_status AFTER UPDATE ON Flights FOR EACH ROW WHEN NEW.departure_time < DATETIME('now') AND OLD.status = 'Scheduled' BEGIN UPDATE Flights SET status = 'Departed' WHERE flight_id = NEW.flight_id; END;

natural_language_query: Find the total fuel cost for all flights in a given month.
sql_query: SELECT SUM(f.fuel_consumption_liters * c.price_per_liter) FROM Flights f JOIN Costs c ON f.flight_id = c.flight_id WHERE STRFTIME('%Y-%m', f.departure_time) = '2023-10';

natural_language_query: List all flights that have a special meal request.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id JOIN SpecialRequests sr ON b.booking_id = sr.booking_id WHERE sr.request_type = 'Meal';

natural_language_query: Find the correlation between aircraft age and maintenance frequency.
sql_query: SELECT CORR(CAST(strftime('%Y', 'now') - manufacturing_year AS REAL), maintenance_count) FROM (SELECT a.manufacturing_year, COUNT(m.maintenance_id) as maintenance_count FROM Aircrafts a JOIN Maintenance m ON a.aircraft_id = m.aircraft_id GROUP BY a.aircraft_id);

natural_language_query: Show the distribution of flight statuses.
sql_query: SELECT status, COUNT(*) FROM Flights GROUP BY status;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that connect through 'DXB'.
sql_query: SELECT f1.flight_number as inbound, f2.flight_number as outbound FROM Flights f1 JOIN Flights f2 ON f1.arrival_airport_id = f2.departure_airport_id WHERE f1.arrival_airport_id = (SELECT airport_id FROM Airports WHERE iata_code = 'DXB');

natural_language_query: List all pilots certified to fly a 'Boeing 747'.
sql_query: SELECT p.name FROM Pilots p JOIN Certifications c ON p.pilot_id = c.pilot_id JOIN Aircrafts a ON c.aircraft_model = a.model WHERE a.model = '747' AND a.manufacturer = 'Boeing';

natural_language_query: What is the average turnaround time for an aircraft at an airport?
sql_query: SELECT AVG((strftime('%s', next_departure) - strftime('%s', arrival_time))/60) as avg_turnaround_minutes FROM (SELECT f1.arrival_time, LEAD(f2.departure_time, 1) OVER (PARTITION BY f1.aircraft_id ORDER BY f1.arrival_time) as next_departure FROM Flights f1 JOIN Flights f2 ON f1.aircraft_id = f2.aircraft_id) WHERE next_departure IS NOT NULL;

natural_language_query: Update the passenger's contact number.
sql_query: UPDATE Passengers SET phone_number = '+1-555-123-4567' WHERE passenger_id = 12345;

natural_language_query: Find the busiest day of the year for air travel.
sql_query: SELECT DATE(departure_time) as day, COUNT(*) as flight_count FROM Flights GROUP BY day ORDER BY flight_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: List all flights that offer Wi-Fi.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Aircrafts a ON f.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id JOIN Amenities am ON a.aircraft_id = am.aircraft_id WHERE am.type = 'Wi-Fi';

natural_language_query: Calculate the carbon footprint for a specific flight.
sql_query: SELECT (f.fuel_consumption_liters * 2.31) as co2_kg FROM Flights f WHERE f.flight_number = 'BA284';

natural_language_query: Find all airports that are above 2000 meters in altitude.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airports WHERE altitude_meters > 2000;

natural_language_query: Show the number of passengers per country of origin.
sql_query: SELECT nationality, COUNT(*) FROM Passengers GROUP BY nationality;

natural_language_query: List all flights that were diverted to a different airport.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE status = 'Diverted';

natural_language_query: Find the most common reason for flight cancellations.
sql_query: SELECT cancellation_reason, COUNT(*) as reason_count FROM Cancellations GROUP BY cancellation_reason ORDER BY reason_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Add a foreign key constraint between the Bookings and Passengers tables.
sql_query: ALTER TABLE Bookings ADD CONSTRAINT fk_passenger FOREIGN KEY (passenger_id) REFERENCES Passengers(passenger_id);

natural_language_query: Find all flights that cross the International Date Line.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights f JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id WHERE (dep.longitude > 0 AND arr.longitude < 0 AND ABS(dep.longitude) + ABS(arr.longitude) > 180) OR (dep.longitude < 0 AND arr.longitude > 0 AND ABS(dep.longitude) + ABS(arr.longitude) > 180);

natural_language_query: List the top 5 routes with the highest average ticket price.
sql_query: SELECT r.name, AVG(t.price) as avg_price FROM Routes r JOIN Flights f ON r.route_id = f.route_id JOIN Tickets t ON f.flight_id = t.flight_id GROUP BY r.name ORDER BY avg_price DESC LIMIT 5;

natural_language_query: Update the status of all 'In Air' flights that have passed their arrival time to 'Landed'.
sql_query: UPDATE Flights SET status = 'Landed' WHERE status = 'In Air' AND arrival_time < DATETIME('now');

natural_language_query: Find the number of flights that depart from each terminal of a specific airport.
sql_query: SELECT g.terminal, COUNT(f.flight_id) FROM Flights f JOIN Gates g ON f.gate_id = g.gate_id WHERE f.departure_airport_id = (SELECT airport_id FROM Airports WHERE iata_code = 'ORD') GROUP BY g.terminal;

natural_language_query: List all employees who are also passengers.
sql_query: SELECT e.* FROM Employees e JOIN Passengers p ON e.passport_number = p.passport_number;

natural_language_query: What is the average age of the aircraft fleet for each airline?
sql_query: SELECT al.name, AVG(CAST(strftime('%Y', 'now') AS INTEGER) - a.manufacturing_year) as avg_age FROM Airlines al JOIN Flights f ON al.airline_id = f.airline_id JOIN Aircrafts a ON f.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id GROUP BY al.name;

natural_language_query: Find the flight with the highest number of special requests.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number, COUNT(sr.request_id) as request_count FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id JOIN SpecialRequests sr ON b.booking_id = sr.booking_id GROUP BY f.flight_number ORDER BY request_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Show all flights that have a 'vegetarian' meal option available.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN FlightAmenities fa ON f.flight_id = fa.flight_id WHERE fa.amenity = 'Vegetarian Meal';

natural_language_query: Delete all flights that were scheduled more than 5 years ago and are completed.
sql_query: DELETE FROM Flights WHERE status = 'Completed' AND departure_time < DATE('now', '-5 years');

natural_language_query: Find the passenger with the most connecting flights on a single ticket.
sql_query: SELECT p.first_name, p.last_name, COUNT(DISTINCT f.flight_id) as flight_legs FROM Passengers p JOIN Tickets t ON p.passenger_id = t.passenger_id JOIN Bookings b ON t.ticket_id = b.ticket_id JOIN Flights f ON b.flight_id = f.flight_id GROUP BY p.passenger_id, t.ticket_id ORDER BY flight_legs DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: List all airports that have a runway longer than 4000 meters.
sql_query: SELECT a.* FROM Airports a JOIN Runways r ON a.airport_id = r.airport_id WHERE r.length_meters > 4000;

natural_language_query: Calculate the monthly revenue for each airline.
sql_query: SELECT al.name, STRFTIME('%Y-%m', f.departure_time) as month, SUM(t.price) as revenue FROM Airlines al JOIN Flights f ON al.airline_id = f.airline_id JOIN Tickets t ON f.flight_id = t.flight_id GROUP BY al.name, month;

natural_language_query: Find the shortest and longest runway in the world.
sql_query: (SELECT 'Shortest', name, length_meters FROM Runways ORDER BY length_meters ASC LIMIT 1) UNION ALL (SELECT 'Longest', name, length_meters FROM Runways ORDER BY length_meters DESC LIMIT 1);

natural_language_query: Update the gate for a flight 'UA123' to 'B12'.
sql_query: UPDATE Flights SET gate_id = (SELECT gate_id FROM Gates WHERE gate_number = 'B12' AND airport_id = (SELECT departure_airport_id FROM Flights WHERE flight_number = 'UA123')) WHERE flight_number = 'UA123';

natural_language_query: Find all flights that are flying between two countries in the European Union.
sql_query: SELECT f.* FROM Flights f JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id WHERE dep.country IN ('Germany', 'France', 'Spain', ...) AND arr.country IN ('Germany', 'France', 'Spain', ...);

natural_language_query: List all passengers who missed their connecting flight.
sql_query: SELECT p.* FROM Passengers p JOIN Bookings b1 ON p.passenger_id = b1.passenger_id JOIN Flights f1 ON b1.flight_id = f1.flight_id JOIN Bookings b2 ON p.passenger_id = b2.passenger_id JOIN Flights f2 ON b2.flight_id = f2.flight_id WHERE f1.arrival_airport_id = f2.departure_airport_id AND f1.arrival_time > f2.departure_time AND f1.status = 'Landed';

natural_language_query: What is the load factor (occupancy rate) for each airline?
sql_query: SELECT al.name, (SUM(pax_count) * 100.0) / SUM(capacity) as load_factor FROM (SELECT f.airline_id, a.capacity, COUNT(b.booking_id) as pax_count FROM Flights f JOIN Aircrafts a ON f.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id LEFT JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id GROUP BY f.flight_id) AS flight_data JOIN Airlines al ON flight_data.airline_id = al.airline_id GROUP BY al.name;

natural_language_query: Find the most common aircraft manufacturer.
sql_query: SELECT manufacturer, COUNT(*) as aircraft_count FROM Aircrafts GROUP BY manufacturer ORDER BY aircraft_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Show the weather conditions for all departing flights from 'LHR' today.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number, w.conditions, w.temperature_celsius FROM Flights f JOIN Weather w ON f.departure_airport_id = w.airport_id WHERE f.departure_airport_id = (SELECT airport_id FROM Airports WHERE iata_code = 'LHR') AND DATE(f.departure_time) = DATE('now');

natural_language_query: List all flights that have an 'infant' passenger on board.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id JOIN Passengers p ON b.passenger_id = p.passenger_id WHERE p.age < 2;

natural_language_query: Find the average price of a ticket for each class (Economy, Business, First).
sql_query: SELECT class, AVG(price) FROM Tickets GROUP BY class;

natural_language_query: Add a 'frequent_flyer_number' to the Passengers table.
sql_query: ALTER TABLE Passengers ADD COLUMN frequent_flyer_number VARCHAR(20);

natural_language_query: Find the longest a flight has been delayed.
sql_query: SELECT MAX(strftime('%s', arrival_time) - strftime('%s', scheduled_arrival_time)) / 3600.0 as max_delay_hours FROM Flights WHERE status = 'Delayed';

natural_language_query: List all flights that are flying over a specific country (e.g., Canada).
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE ST_Intersects(flight_path, (SELECT geometry FROM Countries WHERE name = 'Canada'));

natural_language_query: Calculate the total number of flight hours for each pilot.
sql_query: SELECT c.pilot_name, SUM((strftime('%s', f.arrival_time) - strftime('%s', f.departure_time))/3600.0) as total_flight_hours FROM Crews c JOIN Flights f ON c.flight_id = f.flight_id GROUP BY c.pilot_name;

natural_language_query: Find the airport with the most connecting flights.
sql_query: SELECT ap.name, COUNT(*) as connection_count FROM Flights f1 JOIN Flights f2 ON f1.arrival_airport_id = f2.departure_airport_id JOIN Airports ap ON f1.arrival_airport_id = ap.airport_id GROUP BY ap.name ORDER BY connection_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the booking status for a passenger to 'Checked-in'.
sql_query: UPDATE Bookings SET status = 'Checked-in' WHERE booking_id = 9876;

natural_language_query: List all airlines and the year they were founded.
sql_query: SELECT name, founded_year FROM Airlines;

natural_language_query: Find the number of flights that experience turbulence.
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT flight_id) FROM FlightEvents WHERE event_type = 'Turbulence';

natural_language_query: Show the change in the number of flights over the last 5 years.
sql_query: SELECT STRFTIME('%Y', departure_time) as year, COUNT(*) FROM Flights WHERE STRFTIME('%Y', departure_time) >= STRFTIME('%Y', 'now', '-5 years') GROUP BY year;

natural_language_query: Find the most fuel-efficient aircraft model.
sql_query: SELECT model, manufacturer, AVG(fuel_consumption_liters / distance_km) as liters_per_km FROM Aircrafts a JOIN Flights f ON a.aircraft_id = f.aircraft_id JOIN Routes r ON f.route_id = r.route_id GROUP BY a.model, a.manufacturer ORDER BY liters_per_km ASC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: List all flights that have been affected by a strike.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE flight_id IN (SELECT flight_id FROM FlightNotes WHERE note LIKE '%strike%');

natural_language_query: Find the average passenger age for each flight.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number, AVG(p.age) FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id JOIN Passengers p ON b.passenger_id = p.passenger_id GROUP BY f.flight_number;

natural_language_query: Add a 'loyalty_tier' column to the Passengers table.
sql_query: ALTER TABLE Passengers ADD COLUMN loyalty_tier VARCHAR(50);

natural_language_query: Find all flights that serve a specific type of cuisine (e.g., 'Japanese').
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Catering c ON f.flight_id = c.flight_id WHERE c.cuisine_type = 'Japanese';

natural_language_query: List the number of flights arriving at each airport per hour.
sql_query: SELECT arr.name, STRFTIME('%H', f.arrival_time) as hour, COUNT(*) FROM Flights f JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id GROUP BY arr.name, hour;

natural_language_query: Find the pilot with the most diverse set of flown aircraft.
sql_query: SELECT c.pilot_name, COUNT(DISTINCT a.model) as unique_models_flown FROM Crews c JOIN Flights f ON c.flight_id = f.flight_id JOIN Aircrafts a ON f.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id GROUP BY c.pilot_name ORDER BY unique_models_flown DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the passport expiry date for a passenger.
sql_query: UPDATE Passengers SET passport_expiry = '2030-12-31' WHERE passenger_id = 54321;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have a 'pet in cabin' request.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id JOIN SpecialRequests sr ON b.booking_id = sr.booking_id WHERE sr.request_type = 'Pet in Cabin';

natural_language_query: List all airports with more than 10 gates.
sql_query: SELECT a.name FROM Airports a JOIN (SELECT airport_id, COUNT(*) as gate_count FROM Gates GROUP BY airport_id) as g ON a.airport_id = g.airport_id WHERE g.gate_count > 10;

natural_language_query: Calculate the on-time performance for each route.
sql_query: SELECT r.name, (COUNT(CASE WHEN f.status = 'On-time' THEN 1 END) * 100.0) / COUNT(*) as on_time_percentage FROM Routes r JOIN Flights f ON r.route_id = f.route_id GROUP BY r.name;

natural_language_query: Find the most common destination for each airline.
sql_query: WITH RankedDestinations AS (SELECT al.name as airline, arr.name as destination, COUNT(*) as flight_count, RANK() OVER (PARTITION BY al.name ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC) as rnk FROM Flights f JOIN Airlines al ON f.airline_id = al.airline_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id GROUP BY al.name, arr.name) SELECT airline, destination, flight_count FROM RankedDestinations WHERE rnk = 1;

natural_language_query: List all flights that have a medical emergency on board.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE flight_id IN (SELECT flight_id FROM FlightEvents WHERE event_type = 'Medical Emergency');

natural_language_query: Find the total number of employees for each airline.
sql_query: SELECT al.name, COUNT(e.employee_id) FROM Airlines al JOIN Employees e ON al.airline_id = e.airline_id GROUP BY al.name;

natural_language_query: Show the seasonal variation in ticket prices for a route.
sql_query: SELECT STRFTIME('%m', f.departure_time) as month, AVG(t.price) FROM Flights f JOIN Tickets t ON f.flight_id = t.flight_id WHERE f.route_id = 456 GROUP BY month;

natural_language_query: Find the aircraft with the highest number of flight hours.
sql_query: SELECT a.model, a.manufacturer, SUM((strftime('%s', f.arrival_time) - strftime('%s', f.departure_time))/3600.0) as total_hours FROM Aircrafts a JOIN Flights f ON a.aircraft_id = f.aircraft_id GROUP BY a.aircraft_id ORDER BY total_hours DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: List all passengers who are part of a group booking.
sql_query: SELECT p.* FROM Passengers p JOIN Bookings b ON p.passenger_id = b.passenger_id WHERE b.group_booking_id IS NOT NULL;

natural_language_query: Find the average number of days between booking and departure.
sql_query: SELECT AVG(JULIANDAY(f.departure_time) - JULIANDAY(b.booking_date)) FROM Bookings b JOIN Flights f ON b.flight_id = f.flight_id;

natural_language_query: Update the airline's CEO name.
sql_query: UPDATE Airlines SET ceo_name = 'Jane Fraser' WHERE name = 'Citigroup Airlines';

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have been delayed due to technical issues.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights f JOIN Delays d ON f.flight_id = d.flight_id WHERE d.reason LIKE '%technical%';

natural_language_query: List all airports that have a 'lounge' amenity.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT a.name FROM Airports a JOIN AirportAmenities aa ON a.airport_id = aa.airport_id WHERE aa.amenity = 'Lounge';

natural_language_query: Calculate the passenger-to-crew ratio for each flight.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number, COUNT(DISTINCT b.passenger_id) * 1.0 / (c.pilot_count + c.copilot_count + c.cabin_crew_count) as pax_crew_ratio FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id JOIN Crews c ON f.flight_id = c.flight_id GROUP BY f.flight_id;

natural_language_query: Find the most common layover airport.
sql_query: SELECT ap.name, COUNT(*) as layover_count FROM Flights f1 JOIN Flights f2 ON f1.arrival_airport_id = f2.departure_airport_id JOIN Airports ap ON f1.arrival_airport_id = ap.airport_id WHERE f1.ticket_id = f2.ticket_id GROUP BY ap.name ORDER BY layover_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: List all flights that have a 'wheelchair assistance' request.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id JOIN SpecialRequests sr ON b.booking_id = sr.booking_id WHERE sr.request_type = 'Wheelchair Assistance';

natural_language_query: Find the percentage of international vs. domestic flights.
sql_query: SELECT (SUM(CASE WHEN dep.country != arr.country THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) * 100.0) / COUNT(*) as international_pct, (SUM(CASE WHEN dep.country = arr.country THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) * 100.0) / COUNT(*) as domestic_pct FROM Flights f JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id;

natural_language_query: Show the number of active aircraft for each manufacturer.
sql_query: SELECT manufacturer, COUNT(*) FROM Aircrafts WHERE status = 'Active' GROUP BY manufacturer;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that depart on a weekend.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE STRFTIME('%w', departure_time) IN ('0', '6');

natural_language_query: List all passengers with a frequent flyer status of 'Gold' or 'Platinum'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Passengers WHERE loyalty_tier IN ('Gold', 'Platinum');

natural_language_query: Find the average maintenance cost per aircraft model.
sql_query: SELECT a.model, a.manufacturer, AVG(m.cost) FROM Aircrafts a JOIN Maintenance m ON a.aircraft_id = m.aircraft_id GROUP BY a.model, a.manufacturer;

natural_language_query: Update the flight's estimated time of arrival (ETA).
sql_query: UPDATE Flights SET estimated_arrival_time = '2023-10-27 15:30:00' WHERE flight_number = 'DL456';

natural_language_query: Find all flights that are flying from a hot country to a cold country in December.
sql_query: SELECT f.* FROM Flights f JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id JOIN Weather w_dep ON dep.airport_id = w_dep.airport_id JOIN Weather w_arr ON arr.airport_id = w_arr.airport_id WHERE STRFTIME('%m', f.departure_time) = '12' AND w_dep.avg_temp_dec > 25 AND w_arr.avg_temp_dec < 5;

natural_language_query: List all co-pilots who have flown with a specific pilot.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT c2.copilot_name FROM Crews c1 JOIN Crews c2 ON c1.flight_id = c2.flight_id WHERE c1.pilot_name = 'John Smith' AND c1.copilot_name != c2.copilot_name;

natural_language_query: Calculate the market share of each airline at a specific airport.
sql_query: SELECT al.name, (COUNT(f.flight_id) * 100.0) / (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Flights WHERE departure_airport_id = 123) as market_share_pct FROM Flights f JOIN Airlines al ON f.airline_id = al.airline_id WHERE f.departure_airport_id = 123 GROUP BY al.name;

natural_language_query: Find the most common baggage allowance for an airline.
sql_query: SELECT baggage_allowance_kg, COUNT(*) as freq FROM Tickets t JOIN Flights f ON t.flight_id = f.flight_id WHERE f.airline_id = 1 GROUP BY baggage_allowance_kg ORDER BY freq DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: List all flights that have had their gate changed in the last hour.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE gate_id != original_gate_id AND gate_change_time > DATETIME('now', '-1 hour');

natural_language_query: Find the number of passengers who have checked in online vs. at the airport.
sql_query: SELECT SUM(CASE WHEN check_in_type = 'Online' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as online_checkins, SUM(CASE WHEN check_in_type = 'Airport' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as airport_checkins FROM Bookings;

natural_language_query: Show the trend of an airline's stock price against its on-time performance.
sql_query: SELECT d.date, s.price, o.on_time_percentage FROM DailyStats d JOIN StockPrices s ON d.date = s.date AND d.airline_id = s.airline_id JOIN OnTimePerformance o ON d.date = o.date AND d.airline_id = o.airline_id WHERE d.airline_id = 1;

natural_language_query: Find all aircraft that are currently grounded.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Aircrafts WHERE status = 'Grounded';

natural_language_query: List all flights that are flying to a city with a major event (e.g., 'Olympics').
sql_query: SELECT f.* FROM Flights f JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id JOIN CityEvents ce ON arr.city = ce.city WHERE ce.event_name = 'Olympics' AND f.departure_time BETWEEN ce.start_date AND ce.end_date;

natural_language_query: Find the average number of connecting passengers per flight.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number, AVG(connection_count) FROM Flights f JOIN (SELECT f1.flight_id, COUNT(DISTINCT f2.passenger_id) as connection_count FROM Flights f1 JOIN Flights f2 ON f1.arrival_airport_id = f2.departure_airport_id WHERE f1.ticket_id = f2.ticket_id GROUP BY f1.flight_id) as connections ON f.flight_id = connections.flight_id GROUP BY f.flight_number;

natural_language_query: Update the aircraft for a flight due to a technical issue.
sql_query: UPDATE Flights SET aircraft_id = (SELECT aircraft_id FROM Aircrafts WHERE model = 'A321neo' AND status = 'Available' LIMIT 1) WHERE flight_number = 'LH123';

natural_language_query: Find all passengers who have a birthday this month and are flying.
sql_query: SELECT p.* FROM Passengers p JOIN Bookings b ON p.passenger_id = b.passenger_id JOIN Flights f ON b.flight_id = f.flight_id WHERE STRFTIME('%m', p.date_of_birth) = STRFTIME('%m', 'now') AND STRFTIME('%Y-%m', f.departure_time) = STRFTIME('%Y-%m', 'now');

natural_language_query: List all airports that are also seaports.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airports WHERE features LIKE '%seaport%';

natural_language_query: Calculate the average delay per airline.
sql_query: SELECT al.name, AVG((strftime('%s', f.arrival_time) - strftime('%s', f.scheduled_arrival_time))/60.0) as avg_delay_minutes FROM Airlines al JOIN Flights f ON al.airline_id = f.airline_id WHERE f.status = 'Delayed' GROUP BY al.name;

natural_language_query: Find the most common aircraft type for short-haul flights.
sql_query: SELECT a.model, a.manufacturer, COUNT(*) as flight_count FROM Aircrafts a JOIN Flights f ON a.aircraft_id = f.aircraft_id JOIN Routes r ON f.route_id = r.route_id WHERE r.distance_km < 3000 GROUP BY a.model, a.manufacturer ORDER BY flight_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: List all flights that have been cancelled due to weather.
sql_query: SELECT f.* FROM Flights f JOIN Cancellations c ON f.flight_id = c.flight_id WHERE c.reason LIKE '%weather%';

natural_language_query: Find the number of unaccompanied minors on each flight.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number, COUNT(*) FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id JOIN Passengers p ON b.passenger_id = p.passenger_id WHERE p.is_unaccompanied_minor = 1 GROUP BY f.flight_number;

natural_language_query: Show the number of flights per hour for the entire day at an airport.
sql_query: SELECT STRFTIME('%H', f.departure_time) as hour, COUNT(*) FROM Flights f WHERE f.departure_airport_id = 123 GROUP BY hour;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have a 'silent' zone or cabin.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN FlightAmenities fa ON f.flight_id = fa.flight_id WHERE fa.amenity = 'Silent Zone';

natural_language_query: List all passengers who have booked a flight in the last 24 hours.
sql_query: SELECT p.* FROM Passengers p JOIN Bookings b ON p.passenger_id = b.passenger_id WHERE b.booking_date > DATETIME('now', '-1 day');

natural_language_query: Find the average ticket price change between booking date and departure date.
sql_query: SELECT AVG(t.price - b.initial_price) FROM Tickets t JOIN Bookings b ON t.booking_id = b.booking_id;

natural_language_query: Update the airline's hub airport.
sql_query: UPDATE Airlines SET hub_airport_id = (SELECT airport_id FROM Airports WHERE iata_code = 'DFW') WHERE name = 'American Airlines';

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have a 'flat-bed' seat in business class.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN SeatConfigurations sc ON f.aircraft_id = sc.aircraft_id WHERE sc.class = 'Business' AND sc.seat_type = 'Flat-bed';

natural_language_query: List all airports that have a direct train connection to the city center.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airports WHERE ground_transportation LIKE '%train%';

natural_language_query: Calculate the total CO2 emissions for an airline in a year.
sql_query: SELECT SUM(f.fuel_consumption_liters * 2.31) as total_co2_kg FROM Flights f WHERE f.airline_id = 1 AND STRFTIME('%Y', f.departure_time) = '2023';

natural_language_query: Find the most common nationality among passengers.
sql_query: SELECT nationality, COUNT(*) as passenger_count FROM Passengers GROUP BY nationality ORDER BY passenger_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: List all flights that have been delayed, and show the original and new departure times.
sql_query: SELECT flight_number, scheduled_departure_time, departure_time FROM Flights WHERE status = 'Delayed';

natural_language_query: Find the number of flights that are code-shared with a specific airline.
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Flights WHERE is_codeshare = 1 AND codeshare_airline_id = 2;

natural_language_query: Show the maintenance history for a specific aircraft.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Maintenance WHERE aircraft_id = (SELECT aircraft_id FROM Aircrafts WHERE registration = 'G-XLEA') ORDER BY maintenance_date DESC;

natural_language_query: Find all passengers who are on a watchlist.
sql_query: SELECT p.* FROM Passengers p JOIN Watchlist w ON p.passport_number = w.passport_number;

natural_language_query: List all flights that are scheduled to fly over a conflict zone.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE ST_Intersects(flight_path, (SELECT geometry FROM ConflictZones WHERE is_active = 1));

natural_language_query: Find the average fare per mile for each airline.
sql_query: SELECT al.name, AVG(t.price / r.distance_km) as avg_fare_per_km FROM Airlines al JOIN Flights f ON al.airline_id = f.airline_id JOIN Tickets t ON f.flight_id = t.flight_id JOIN Routes r ON f.route_id = r.route_id GROUP BY al.name;

natural_language_query: Update the passenger's meal preference.
sql_query: UPDATE Bookings SET meal_preference = 'VGML' WHERE booking_id = 12345;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have an all-female crew.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Crews c ON f.flight_id = c.flight_id WHERE c.pilot_gender = 'F' AND c.copilot_gender = 'F' AND (SELECT MIN(gender) FROM CabinCrew cc WHERE cc.crew_id = c.crew_id) = 'F';

natural_language_query: List all airports that have a 5-star Skytrax rating.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airports WHERE skytrax_rating = 5;

natural_language_query: Calculate the percentage of flights that arrive early, on-time, or late.
sql_query: SELECT status, (COUNT(*) * 100.0 / (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Flights)) as percentage FROM (SELECT CASE WHEN arrival_time < scheduled_arrival_time THEN 'Early' WHEN arrival_time = scheduled_arrival_time THEN 'On-time' ELSE 'Late' END as status FROM Flights) GROUP BY status;

natural_language_query: Find the most common aircraft used for transatlantic flights.
sql_query: SELECT a.model, a.manufacturer, COUNT(*) as flight_count FROM Aircrafts a JOIN Flights f ON a.aircraft_id = f.aircraft_id JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id WHERE dep.continent = 'North America' AND arr.continent = 'Europe' GROUP BY a.model, a.manufacturer ORDER BY flight_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: List all flights that have a passenger celebrating a honeymoon.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id JOIN SpecialRequests sr ON b.booking_id = sr.booking_id WHERE sr.request_type = 'Honeymoon';

natural_language_query: Find the number of flights that have been impacted by air traffic control restrictions.
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM FlightDelays WHERE reason LIKE '%ATC%';

natural_language_query: Show the number of passengers traveling with pets per month.
sql_query: SELECT STRFTIME('%Y-%m', f.departure_time) as month, COUNT(DISTINCT p.passenger_id) FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id JOIN Passengers p ON b.passenger_id = p.passenger_id JOIN SpecialRequests sr ON b.booking_id = sr.booking_id WHERE sr.request_type = 'Pet in Cabin' GROUP BY month;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have a 'meet and assist' service requested.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id JOIN SpecialRequests sr ON b.booking_id = sr.booking_id WHERE sr.request_type = 'Meet and Assist';

natural_language_query: List all airports with a designated smoking area.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airports WHERE amenities LIKE '%Smoking Area%';

natural_language_query: Find the average baggage weight per passenger for each flight.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number, AVG(b.weight_kg) FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings bk ON f.flight_id = bk.flight_id JOIN Baggage b ON bk.booking_id = b.booking_id GROUP BY f.flight_number;

natural_language_query: Update the airline's contact email address.
sql_query: UPDATE Airlines SET contact_email = 'support@newairline.com' WHERE name = 'New Airline';

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have a 'child meal' request.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id JOIN SpecialRequests sr ON b.booking_id = sr.booking_id WHERE sr.request_type = 'Child Meal';

natural_language_query: List all pilots who are also instructors.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Pilots WHERE is_instructor = 1;

natural_language_query: Calculate the revenue per available seat mile (RASM) for an airline.
