sql_query: SELECT AVG(JULIANDAY(f.departure_time) - JULIANDAY(c.certification_date)) FROM Certifications c JOIN Crews cr ON c.pilot_id = cr.pilot_id JOIN Flights f ON cr.flight_id = f.flight_id JOIN Aircrafts a ON f.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id WHERE c.aircraft_model = a.model;

natural_language_query: Update the timezone for all airports in a specific country.
sql_query: UPDATE Airports SET timezone = 'Europe/Paris' WHERE country = 'France';

natural_language_query: Find all flights where the cabin crew outnumber the passengers.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Crews c ON f.flight_id = c.flight_id JOIN (SELECT flight_id, COUNT(*) as pax_count FROM Bookings GROUP BY flight_id) as pax ON f.flight_id = pax.flight_id WHERE c.cabin_crew_count > pax.pax_count;

natural_language_query: List all airports that can handle an Airbus A380.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airports WHERE can_handle_a380 = 1;

natural_language_query: Calculate the total flight time for each aircraft registration.
sql_query: SELECT a.registration, SUM((strftime('%s', f.arrival_time) - strftime('%s', f.departure_time))/3600.0) as total_flight_hours FROM Aircrafts a JOIN Flights f ON a.aircraft_id = f.aircraft_id GROUP BY a.registration;

natural_language_query: Find the most common city pair for connecting flights.
sql_query: SELECT dep.city, arr.city, COUNT(*) as connection_count FROM Flights f1 JOIN Flights f2 ON f1.arrival_airport_id = f2.departure_airport_id JOIN Airports dep ON f1.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f2.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id WHERE f1.ticket_id = f2.ticket_id GROUP BY dep.city, arr.city ORDER BY connection_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: List all passengers who have booked a flight with a flexible ticket.
sql_query: SELECT p.* FROM Passengers p JOIN Bookings b ON p.passenger_id = b.passenger_id JOIN Tickets t ON b.ticket_id = t.ticket_id WHERE t.is_flexible = 1;

natural_language_query: Find the number of flights that have been cancelled for each airline.
sql_query: SELECT al.name, COUNT(*) as cancelled_flights FROM Airlines al JOIN Flights f ON al.airline_id = f.airline_id WHERE f.status = 'Cancelled' GROUP BY al.name;

natural_language_query: Show the top 3 most common maintenance tasks.
sql_query: SELECT description, COUNT(*) as task_count FROM Maintenance GROUP BY description ORDER BY task_count DESC LIMIT 3;

natural_language_query: Find all aircraft that were manufactured in the 1990s.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Aircrafts WHERE manufacturing_year BETWEEN 1990 AND 1999;

natural_language_query: List all passengers who have a loyalty status but have not flown in the last year.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Passengers WHERE loyalty_tier IS NOT NULL AND passenger_id NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT passenger_id FROM Bookings b JOIN Flights f ON b.flight_id = f.flight_id WHERE f.departure_time > DATE('now', '-1 year'));

natural_language_query: Calculate the average number of passengers on flights between two continents.
sql_query: SELECT dep.continent, arr.continent, AVG(pax_count) FROM Flights f JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id JOIN (SELECT flight_id, COUNT(booking_id) as pax_count FROM Bookings GROUP BY flight_id) as flight_data ON f.flight_id = flight_data.flight_id GROUP BY dep.continent, arr.continent;

natural_language_query: Find the pilot and copilot pair that have flown together the most.
sql_query: SELECT pilot_id, copilot_id, COUNT(*) as flights_together FROM Crews GROUP BY pilot_id, copilot_id ORDER BY flights_together DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the aircraft capacity for a specific registration number.
sql_query: UPDATE Aircrafts SET capacity = 320 WHERE registration = 'G-CIVB';

natural_language_query: Find all flights that had to use a backup pilot.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE backup_pilot_id IS NOT NULL;

natural_language_query: List all airports that have a dedicated cargo terminal.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airports WHERE has_cargo_terminal = 1;

natural_language_query: Find the average delay time for each airline on international routes.
sql_query: SELECT al.name, AVG((strftime('%s', f.arrival_time) - strftime('%s', f.scheduled_arrival_time))/60.0) as avg_delay FROM Airlines al JOIN Flights f ON al.airline_id = f.airline_id JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id WHERE f.status = 'Delayed' AND dep.country != arr.country GROUP BY al.name;

natural_language_query: Add a 'notes' column to the Passengers table.
sql_query: ALTER TABLE Passengers ADD COLUMN notes TEXT;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have a passenger with a severe allergy on board.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id JOIN SpecialRequests sr ON b.booking_id = sr.booking_id WHERE sr.request_type = 'Severe Allergy';

natural_language_query: List all aircraft that are leased and not owned by the airline.
sql_query: SELECT a.* FROM Aircrafts a JOIN FleetInfo fi ON a.aircraft_id = fi.aircraft_id WHERE fi.ownership_status = 'Leased';

natural_language_query: Find the total number of passengers who have traveled to every airport in a specific country.
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM (SELECT p.passenger_id FROM Passengers p WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT ap.airport_id FROM Airports ap WHERE ap.country = 'Japan' EXCEPT SELECT DISTINCT f.arrival_airport_id FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id WHERE b.passenger_id = p.passenger_id));

natural_language_query: Create a trigger to log all updates to the Flights table status.
sql_query: CREATE TRIGGER log_flight_status_change AFTER UPDATE OF status ON Flights FOR EACH ROW BEGIN INSERT INTO FlightStatusLog (flight_id, old_status, new_status, change_timestamp) VALUES (OLD.flight_id, OLD.status, NEW.status, DATETIME('now')); END;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have departed but not yet landed.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE status = 'In Air' OR status = 'Departed';

natural_language_query: List all maintenance checks performed by a specific technician.
sql_query: SELECT m.* FROM Maintenance m JOIN Technicians t ON m.technician_id = t.technician_id WHERE t.name = 'Bob Smith';

natural_language_query: Find the average number of available seats on flights to a specific city.
sql_query: SELECT AVG(a.capacity - pax_count) FROM Flights f JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id JOIN Aircrafts a ON f.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id LEFT JOIN (SELECT flight_id, COUNT(booking_id) as pax_count FROM Bookings GROUP BY flight_id) as flight_data ON f.flight_id = flight_data.flight_id WHERE arr.city = 'Dubai' ;

natural_language_query: Update the seat number for a passenger on a specific flight.
sql_query: UPDATE Bookings SET seat_number = '14A' WHERE passenger_id = 12345 AND flight_id = 6789;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have a crew member whose birthday is on the day of the flight.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Crews c ON f.flight_id = c.flight_id JOIN CrewMembers cm ON c.crew_member_id = cm.crew_member_id WHERE STRFTIME('%m-%d', f.departure_time) = STRFTIME('%m-%d', cm.date_of_birth);

natural_language_query: List all airports that have more than 5 runways.
sql_query: SELECT a.name FROM Airports a JOIN (SELECT airport_id, COUNT(*) as runway_count FROM Runways GROUP BY airport_id) as r ON a.airport_id = r.airport_id WHERE r.runway_count > 5;

natural_language_query: Calculate the total fuel cost per airline.
sql_query: SELECT al.name, SUM(f.fuel_consumption_liters * c.price_per_liter) as total_fuel_cost FROM Airlines al JOIN Flights f ON al.airline_id = f.airline_id JOIN Costs c ON f.flight_id = c.flight_id GROUP BY al.name;

natural_language_query: Find the most common aircraft used for flights between 'LHR' and 'JFK'.
sql_query: SELECT a.model, a.manufacturer, COUNT(*) as flight_count FROM Aircrafts a JOIN Flights f ON a.aircraft_id = f.aircraft_id JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id WHERE dep.iata_code = 'LHR' AND arr.iata_code = 'JFK' GROUP BY a.model, a.manufacturer ORDER BY flight_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: List all passengers who have booked a flight in first class but have a 'Silver' loyalty status.
sql_query: SELECT p.* FROM Passengers p JOIN Bookings b ON p.passenger_id = b.passenger_id JOIN Tickets t ON b.ticket_id = t.ticket_id WHERE t.class = 'First' AND p.loyalty_tier = 'Silver';

natural_language_query: Find the number of flights that were diverted due to bad weather at the destination.
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Flights WHERE status = 'Diverted' AND diversion_reason LIKE '%weather%';

natural_language_query: Show the top 5 busiest routes during the summer.
sql_query: SELECT dep.name, arr.name, COUNT(*) as flight_count FROM Flights f JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id WHERE STRFTIME('%m', f.departure_time) IN ('06', '07', '08') GROUP BY dep.name, arr.name ORDER BY flight_count DESC LIMIT 5;

natural_language_query: Find all aircraft that have an entertainment system from 'Panasonic'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Aircrafts a JOIN Amenities am ON a.aircraft_id = am.aircraft_id WHERE am.type = 'In-flight Entertainment' AND am.provider = 'Panasonic';

natural_language_query: List all pilots who have an expired medical certificate.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Pilots WHERE medical_expiry_date < DATE('now');

natural_language_query: Calculate the percentage of passengers who check in online.
sql_query: SELECT (COUNT(CASE WHEN check_in_type = 'Online' THEN 1 END) * 100.0) / COUNT(*) FROM Bookings;

natural_language_query: Find the pilot who has flown the greatest number of unique routes.
sql_query: SELECT p.name, COUNT(DISTINCT f.route_id) as unique_routes FROM Pilots p JOIN Crews c ON p.pilot_id = c.pilot_id JOIN Flights f ON c.flight_id = f.flight_id GROUP BY p.pilot_id ORDER BY unique_routes DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the airline's country of origin.
sql_query: UPDATE Airlines SET country = 'United Arab Emirates' WHERE name = 'Etihad Airways';

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have a special request for an oxygen bottle.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id JOIN SpecialRequests sr ON b.booking_id = sr.booking_id WHERE sr.request_type = 'Medical Oxygen';

natural_language_query: List all airports that have a hotel inside the terminal.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airports WHERE amenities LIKE '%In-Terminal Hotel%';

natural_language_query: Find the average number of bookings per flight for each airline.
sql_query: SELECT al.name, AVG(booking_count) FROM Airlines al JOIN (SELECT f.airline_id, f.flight_id, COUNT(b.booking_id) as booking_count FROM Flights f LEFT JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id GROUP BY f.flight_id) as flight_data ON al.airline_id = flight_data.airline_id GROUP BY al.name;

natural_language_query: Add a 'date_of_hire' column to the Employees table.
sql_query: ALTER TABLE Employees ADD COLUMN date_of_hire DATE;

natural_language_query: Find all flights where the arrival was more than 30 minutes earlier than scheduled.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE (strftime('%s', scheduled_arrival_time) - strftime('%s', arrival_time)) > 1800;

natural_language_query: List all cabin crew members who are certified for first aid.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM CabinCrew WHERE first_aid_certified = 1;

natural_language_query: Find the total number of passengers who flew on a specific day.
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT b.passenger_id) FROM Bookings b JOIN Flights f ON b.flight_id = f.flight_id WHERE DATE(f.departure_time) = '2023-11-15';

natural_language_query: Create a view that lists all active pilots and their total flight hours.
sql_query: CREATE VIEW ActivePilotHours AS SELECT p.name, p.total_flight_hours FROM Pilots p WHERE p.is_active = 1;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have a passenger with the same name as a crew member.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id JOIN Passengers p ON b.passenger_id = p.passenger_id JOIN Crews c ON f.flight_id = c.flight_id JOIN CrewMembers cm ON c.crew_member_id = cm.crew_member_id WHERE p.first_name = cm.first_name AND p.last_name = cm.last_name;

natural_language_query: List all maintenance events that cost more than $50,000.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Maintenance WHERE cost > 50000;

natural_language_query: Find the average number of flights an aircraft makes before its first major maintenance check.
sql_query: WITH FirstMajorCheck AS (SELECT aircraft_id, MIN(maintenance_date) as first_check_date FROM Maintenance WHERE is_major_check = 1 GROUP BY aircraft_id) SELECT AVG(flight_count) FROM (SELECT fmc.aircraft_id, COUNT(f.flight_id) as flight_count FROM FirstMajorCheck fmc JOIN Flights f ON fmc.aircraft_id = f.aircraft_id WHERE f.departure_time < fmc.first_check_date GROUP BY fmc.aircraft_id);

natural_language_query: Update the latitude and longitude for a specific airport.
sql_query: UPDATE Airports SET latitude = 40.6413, longitude = -73.7781 WHERE iata_code = 'JFK';

natural_language_query: Find all flights where the number of passengers is less than 10% of the aircraft capacity.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Aircrafts a ON f.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id LEFT JOIN (SELECT flight_id, COUNT(booking_id) as pax_count FROM Bookings GROUP BY flight_id) as flight_data ON f.flight_id = flight_data.flight_id WHERE (flight_data.pax_count * 1.0 / a.capacity) < 0.1;

natural_language_query: List all airports that have a dedicated prayer room for multiple faiths.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airports WHERE amenities LIKE '%Multi-Faith Prayer Room%';

natural_language_query: Calculate the total number of miles flown by all passengers of a specific nationality.
sql_query: SELECT SUM(r.distance_miles) FROM Passengers p JOIN Bookings b ON p.passenger_id = b.passenger_id JOIN Flights f ON b.flight_id = f.flight_id JOIN Routes r ON f.route_id = r.route_id WHERE p.nationality = 'British';

natural_language_query: Find the most common aircraft manufacturer for each airline alliance.
sql_query: WITH AllianceManufacturers AS (SELECT al.alliance, a.manufacturer, COUNT(*) as aircraft_count, RANK() OVER (PARTITION BY al.alliance ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC) as rnk FROM Airlines al JOIN Flights f ON al.airline_id = f.airline_id JOIN Aircrafts a ON f.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id GROUP BY al.alliance, a.manufacturer) SELECT alliance, manufacturer, aircraft_count FROM AllianceManufacturers WHERE rnk = 1;

natural_language_query: List all passengers who have booked a flight departing on their birthday.
sql_query: SELECT p.* FROM Passengers p JOIN Bookings b ON p.passenger_id = b.passenger_id JOIN Flights f ON b.flight_id = f.flight_id WHERE STRFTIME('%m-%d', p.date_of_birth) = STRFTIME('%m-%d', f.departure_time);

natural_language_query: Find the number of flights delayed due to air traffic control, by airport.
sql_query: SELECT ap.name, COUNT(*) as atc_delay_count FROM Airports ap JOIN Flights f ON ap.airport_id = f.departure_airport_id JOIN Delays d ON f.flight_id = d.flight_id WHERE d.reason LIKE '%ATC%' GROUP BY ap.name;

natural_language_query: Show the top 5 routes with the highest passenger load factor.
sql_query: SELECT dep.name, arr.name, AVG((pax_count * 100.0) / a.capacity) as avg_load_factor FROM Flights f JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id JOIN Aircrafts a ON f.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id LEFT JOIN (SELECT flight_id, COUNT(booking_id) as pax_count FROM Bookings GROUP BY flight_id) as flight_data ON f.flight_id = flight_data.flight_id GROUP BY dep.name, arr.name ORDER BY avg_load_factor DESC LIMIT 5;

natural_language_query: Find all aircraft that have only ever flown domestic routes.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Aircrafts WHERE aircraft_id NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT f.aircraft_id FROM Flights f JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id WHERE dep.country != arr.country);

natural_language_query: List all pilots who are certified to land at a specific challenging airport (e.g., LUKLA).
sql_query: SELECT p.* FROM Pilots p JOIN PilotCertifications pc ON p.pilot_id = pc.pilot_id WHERE pc.airport_iata = 'LUA' AND pc.certification_type = 'Special Landing';

natural_language_query: Calculate the percentage of total revenue that comes from each ticket class.
sql_query: SELECT class, (SUM(price) * 100.0 / (SELECT SUM(price) FROM Tickets)) as revenue_percentage FROM Tickets GROUP BY class;

natural_language_query: Find the crew member who has worked on the most delayed flights.
sql_query: SELECT cm.name, COUNT(*) as delayed_flight_count FROM CrewMembers cm JOIN Crews c ON cm.crew_member_id = c.crew_member_id JOIN Flights f ON c.flight_id = f.flight_id WHERE f.status = 'Delayed' GROUP BY cm.crew_member_id ORDER BY delayed_flight_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the 'status' of all aircraft under maintenance for more than 30 days to 'AOG' (Aircraft on Ground).
sql_query: UPDATE Aircrafts SET status = 'AOG' WHERE status = 'Under Maintenance' AND last_maintenance_start_date < DATE('now', '-30 days');

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have had to make an emergency landing.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE flight_id IN (SELECT flight_id FROM FlightEvents WHERE event_type = 'Emergency Landing');

natural_language_query: List all airports that have a post office.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airports WHERE amenities LIKE '%Post Office%';

natural_language_query: Find the average number of passengers on flights operated by 'Boeing' aircraft versus 'Airbus' aircraft.
sql_query: SELECT a.manufacturer, AVG(pax_count) FROM Aircrafts a JOIN Flights f ON a.aircraft_id = f.aircraft_id LEFT JOIN (SELECT flight_id, COUNT(booking_id) as pax_count FROM Bookings GROUP BY flight_id) as flight_data ON f.flight_id = flight_data.flight_id WHERE a.manufacturer IN ('Boeing', 'Airbus') GROUP BY a.manufacturer;

natural_language_query: Add a 'emergency_contact_phone' column to the Passengers table.
sql_query: ALTER TABLE Passengers ADD COLUMN emergency_contact_phone VARCHAR(20);

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have a passenger who is a medical doctor.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id JOIN Passengers p ON b.passenger_id = b.passenger_id WHERE p.occupation = 'Doctor';

natural_language_query: List all aircraft that have been repainted in the last year.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Aircrafts WHERE aircraft_id IN (SELECT aircraft_id FROM Maintenance WHERE description = 'Repainting' AND maintenance_date > DATE('now', '-1 year'));

natural_language_query: Find the total number of seats on all aircraft for each airline.
sql_query: SELECT al.name, SUM(a.capacity) as total_seat_capacity FROM Airlines al JOIN Fleet f ON al.airline_id = f.airline_id JOIN Aircrafts a ON f.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id GROUP BY al.name;

natural_language_query: Create a view that shows the next departure for each gate at a specific airport.
sql_query: CREATE VIEW JFK_Gate_Departures AS WITH RankedDepartures AS (SELECT gate_id, flight_number, departure_time, RANK() OVER (PARTITION BY gate_id ORDER BY departure_time) as rnk FROM Flights WHERE departure_airport_id = (SELECT airport_id FROM Airports WHERE iata_code = 'JFK') AND departure_time > DATETIME('now')) SELECT gate_id, flight_number, departure_time FROM RankedDepartures WHERE rnk = 1;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have a passenger with a diplomatic passport.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id JOIN Passengers p ON b.passenger_id = p.passenger_id WHERE p.passport_type = 'Diplomatic';

natural_language_query: List all maintenance tasks that are currently overdue.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM MaintenanceSchedule WHERE due_date < DATE('now') AND status != 'Completed';

natural_language_query: Find the average number of crew members per flight for each route.
sql_query: SELECT r.name, AVG(c.pilot_count + c.copilot_count + c.cabin_crew_count) as avg_crew_size FROM Routes r JOIN Flights f ON r.route_id = f.route_id JOIN Crews c ON f.flight_id = c.flight_id GROUP BY r.name;

natural_language_query: Update the home base airport for a specific pilot.
sql_query: UPDATE Pilots SET home_base_iata = 'MIA' WHERE pilot_id = 567;

natural_language_query: Find all flights where the arrival time is in a different year than the departure time.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE STRFTIME('%Y', arrival_time) != STRFTIME('%Y', departure_time);

natural_language_query: List all airports that have a baggage storage facility.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airports WHERE amenities LIKE '%Baggage Storage%';

natural_language_query: Calculate the total number of passengers carried by each airline last month.
sql_query: SELECT al.name, COUNT(DISTINCT b.passenger_id) as total_passengers FROM Airlines al JOIN Flights f ON al.airline_id = f.airline_id JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id WHERE STRFTIME('%Y-%m', f.departure_time) = STRFTIME('%Y-%m', 'now', '-1 month') GROUP BY al.name;

natural_language_query: Find the most common route for each aircraft model.
sql_query: WITH RankedRoutes AS (SELECT a.model, f.route_id, COUNT(*) as flight_count, RANK() OVER (PARTITION BY a.model ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC) as rnk FROM Aircrafts a JOIN Flights f ON a.aircraft_id = f.aircraft_id GROUP BY a.model, f.route_id) SELECT rr.model, r.name, rr.flight_count FROM RankedRoutes rr JOIN Routes r ON rr.route_id = r.route_id WHERE rr.rnk = 1;

natural_language_query: List all passengers who have booked a flight but have not selected a seat.
sql_query: SELECT p.* FROM Passengers p JOIN Bookings b ON p.passenger_id = b.passenger_id WHERE b.seat_number IS NULL;

natural_language_query: Find the number of flights that have been diverted for each airline.
sql_query: SELECT al.name, COUNT(*) as diverted_flights FROM Airlines al JOIN Flights f ON al.airline_id = f.airline_id WHERE f.status = 'Diverted' GROUP BY al.name;

natural_language_query: Show the top 5 pilots with the most flying hours on a 'Boeing 747'.
sql_query: SELECT p.name, SUM((strftime('%s', f.arrival_time) - strftime('%s', f.departure_time))/3600.0) as hours_on_747 FROM Pilots p JOIN Crews c ON p.pilot_id = c.pilot_id JOIN Flights f ON c.flight_id = f.flight_id JOIN Aircrafts a ON f.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id WHERE a.model = '747' GROUP BY p.pilot_id ORDER BY hours_on_747 DESC LIMIT 5;

natural_language_query: Find all aircraft that have been in service for more than 25 years.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Aircrafts WHERE (CAST(strftime('%Y', 'now') AS INTEGER) - manufacturing_year) > 25;

natural_language_query: List all passengers who are traveling with more than 3 checked bags.
sql_query: SELECT p.first_name, p.last_name FROM Passengers p JOIN (SELECT b.passenger_id, COUNT(cb.baggage_id) as bag_count FROM Bookings b JOIN CheckedBaggage cb ON b.booking_id = cb.booking_id GROUP BY b.passenger_id) as baggage_data ON p.passenger_id = baggage_data.passenger_id WHERE baggage_data.bag_count > 3;

natural_language_query: Calculate the average on-time performance for flights departing on a Friday.
sql_query: SELECT AVG(CASE WHEN f.status = 'On-time' THEN 100.0 ELSE 0 END) FROM Flights f WHERE STRFTIME('%w', f.departure_time) = '5';

natural_language_query: Find the crew that has flown the most miles together.
sql_query: SELECT c.pilot_id, c.copilot_id, SUM(r.distance_miles) as total_miles_flown FROM Crews c JOIN Flights f ON c.flight_id = f.flight_id JOIN Routes r ON f.route_id = r.route_id GROUP BY c.pilot_id, c.copilot_id ORDER BY total_miles_flown DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the 'is_public' flag for a specific flight note.
sql_query: UPDATE FlightNotes SET is_public = 0 WHERE note_id = 123;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have a passenger whose age is over 100.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id JOIN Passengers p ON b.passenger_id = p.passenger_id WHERE p.age > 100;

natural_language_query: List all airports that have a car rental service from 'Hertz'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airports a JOIN AirportServices s ON a.airport_id = s.airport_id WHERE s.service_type = 'Car Rental' AND s.provider_name = 'Hertz';

natural_language_query: Find the average number of flights per route.
sql_query: SELECT AVG(flight_count) FROM (SELECT route_id, COUNT(*) as flight_count FROM Flights GROUP BY route_id);

natural_language_query: Add a 'visa_required' column to the Routes table.
sql_query: ALTER TABLE Routes ADD COLUMN visa_required BOOLEAN;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have a baggage item heavier than 32kg.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id JOIN Baggage bg ON b.booking_id = bg.booking_id WHERE bg.weight_kg > 32;

natural_language_query: List all pilots who are also certified as mechanics.
sql_query: SELECT p.* FROM Pilots p JOIN Employees e ON p.employee_id = e.employee_id WHERE e.role = 'Mechanic';

natural_language_query: Find the total number of passengers who have flown to 'HNL' in the last year.
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT b.passenger_id) FROM Bookings b JOIN Flights f ON b.flight_id = f.flight_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id WHERE arr.iata_code = 'HNL' AND f.arrival_time > DATE('now', '-1 year');

natural_language_query: Create a trigger that prevents deleting an airline if it still has active flights.
sql_query: CREATE TRIGGER prevent_airline_deletion BEFORE DELETE ON Airlines FOR EACH ROW BEGIN SELECT RAISE(ABORT, 'Cannot delete airline with active flights') WHERE (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Flights WHERE airline_id = OLD.airline_id AND status != 'Completed') > 0; END;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have experienced severe turbulence.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE flight_id IN (SELECT flight_id FROM FlightEvents WHERE event_type = 'Turbulence' AND severity = 'Severe');

natural_language_query: List all maintenance events that happened on a weekend.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Maintenance WHERE STRFTIME('%w', maintenance_date) IN ('0', '6');

natural_language_query: Find the average number of days between a passenger's bookings.
sql_query: WITH PassengerBookings AS (SELECT passenger_id, booking_date, LAG(booking_date, 1) OVER (PARTITION BY passenger_id ORDER BY booking_date) as previous_booking_date FROM Bookings) SELECT AVG(JULIANDAY(booking_date) - JULIANDAY(previous_booking_date)) FROM PassengerBookings WHERE previous_booking_date IS NOT NULL;

natural_language_query: Update the 'country' for an airport.
sql_query: UPDATE Airports SET country = 'United Kingdom' WHERE iata_code = 'LHR';

natural_language_query: Find all flights where the aircraft has less than 1 year of service.
sql_query: SELECT f.* FROM Flights f JOIN Aircrafts a ON f.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id WHERE (CAST(strftime('%Y', 'now') AS INTEGER) - a.manufacturing_year) < 1;

natural_language_query: List all airports that have a dedicated mobile app.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airports WHERE has_mobile_app = 1;

natural_language_query: Calculate the total number of available seat-miles (ASMs) for an airline.
sql_query: SELECT SUM(a.capacity * r.distance_miles) as total_asms FROM Airlines al JOIN Flights f ON al.airline_id = f.airline_id JOIN Aircrafts a ON f.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id JOIN Routes r ON f.route_id = r.route_id WHERE al.name = 'American Airlines';

natural_language_query: Find the most common departure hour for each airline.
sql_query: WITH RankedHours AS (SELECT al.name, STRFTIME('%H', f.departure_time) as hour, COUNT(*) as flight_count, RANK() OVER (PARTITION BY al.name ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC) as rnk FROM Airlines al JOIN Flights f ON al.airline_id = f.airline_id GROUP BY al.name, hour) SELECT name, hour, flight_count FROM RankedHours WHERE rnk = 1;

natural_language_query: List all passengers who have booked a flight on the same day as their birthday.
sql_query: SELECT p.* FROM Passengers p JOIN Bookings b ON p.passenger_id = b.passenger_id WHERE STRFTIME('%m-%d', p.date_of_birth) = STRFTIME('%m-%d', b.booking_date);

natural_language_query: Find the number of flights that have been cancelled due to 'operational reasons'.
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Flights f JOIN Cancellations c ON f.flight_id = c.flight_id WHERE c.reason = 'Operational Reasons';

natural_language_query: Show the top 3 aircraft models with the highest average load factor.
sql_query: SELECT a.model, a.manufacturer, AVG((pax_count * 100.0) / a.capacity) as avg_load_factor FROM Aircrafts a JOIN Flights f ON a.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id LEFT JOIN (SELECT flight_id, COUNT(booking_id) as pax_count FROM Bookings GROUP BY flight_id) as flight_data ON f.flight_id = flight_data.flight_id GROUP BY a.model, a.manufacturer ORDER BY avg_load_factor DESC LIMIT 3;

natural_language_query: Find all aircraft that have been involved in a safety incident.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Aircrafts WHERE aircraft_id IN (SELECT aircraft_id FROM SafetyReports);

natural_language_query: List all pilots who are scheduled to fly on their birthday.
sql_query: SELECT p.* FROM Pilots p JOIN Crews c ON p.pilot_id = c.pilot_id JOIN Flights f ON c.flight_id = f.flight_id WHERE STRFTIME('%m-%d', p.date_of_birth) = STRFTIME('%m-%d', f.departure_time);

natural_language_query: Calculate the percentage of revenue generated by each airline alliance.
sql_query: SELECT al.alliance, (SUM(t.price) * 100.0 / (SELECT SUM(price) FROM Tickets)) as revenue_percentage FROM Airlines al JOIN Flights f ON al.airline_id = f.airline_id JOIN Tickets t ON f.flight_id = t.flight_id WHERE al.alliance IS NOT NULL GROUP BY al.alliance;

natural_language_query: Find the passenger who has made the most special requests.
sql_query: SELECT p.first_name, p.last_name, COUNT(sr.request_id) as request_count FROM Passengers p JOIN Bookings b ON p.passenger_id = b.passenger_id JOIN SpecialRequests sr ON b.booking_id = sr.booking_id GROUP BY p.passenger_id ORDER BY request_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the 'is_operational' flag for a specific runway.
sql_query: UPDATE Runways SET is_operational = 0 WHERE runway_id = 45;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have had a change in both pilot and copilot mid-journey.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE flight_id IN (SELECT flight_id FROM CrewChangeLog GROUP BY flight_id HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT pilot_id) > 1 AND COUNT(DISTINCT copilot_id) > 1);

natural_language_query: List all airports that have a VIP terminal.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airports WHERE has_vip_terminal = 1;

natural_language_query: Find the average number of passengers on flights departing on a Monday vs. a Saturday.
sql_query: SELECT STRFTIME('%w', f.departure_time) as day_of_week, AVG(pax_count) FROM Flights f JOIN (SELECT flight_id, COUNT(booking_id) as pax_count FROM Bookings GROUP BY flight_id) as flight_data ON f.flight_id = flight_data.flight_id WHERE day_of_week IN ('1', '6') GROUP BY day_of_week;

natural_language_query: Add a 'last_login' timestamp column to the Users table.
sql_query: ALTER TABLE Users ADD COLUMN last_login TIMESTAMP;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have transported cargo for a specific company.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Cargo c ON f.flight_id = c.flight_id WHERE c.shipper_company = 'PharmaCorp';

natural_language_query: List all pilots who are based at an airport in a different country from their nationality.
sql_query: SELECT p.* FROM Pilots p JOIN Airports a ON p.home_base_iata = a.iata_code WHERE p.nationality != a.country;

natural_language_query: Find the total number of passengers who have flown on a codeshare flight.
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT b.passenger_id) FROM Bookings b JOIN Flights f ON b.flight_id = f.flight_id WHERE f.is_codeshare = 1;

natural_language_query: Create a view that shows the number of flights and total passengers for each route.
sql_query: CREATE VIEW RouteSummary AS SELECT r.name, COUNT(f.flight_id) as total_flights, COUNT(b.booking_id) as total_passengers FROM Routes r JOIN Flights f ON r.route_id = f.route_id LEFT JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id GROUP BY r.name;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have a passenger who is an employee of the airline.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id JOIN Passengers p ON b.passenger_id = p.passenger_id JOIN Employees e ON p.employee_id = e.employee_id WHERE f.airline_id = e.airline_id;

natural_language_query: List all maintenance events that were completed ahead of schedule.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Maintenance WHERE completion_date < scheduled_completion_date;

natural_language_query: Find the average number of flights a pilot makes per month.
sql_query: SELECT p.name, AVG(monthly_flights) FROM Pilots p JOIN (SELECT pilot_id, STRFTIME('%Y-%m', f.departure_time) as month, COUNT(*) as monthly_flights FROM Crews c JOIN Flights f ON c.flight_id = f.flight_id GROUP BY pilot_id, month) as pilot_activity ON p.pilot_id = pilot_activity.pilot_id GROUP BY p.name;

natural_language_query: Update the 'alliance' for all airlines based in a specific country.
sql_query: UPDATE Airlines SET alliance = 'SkyTeam' WHERE country = 'France';

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have a passenger with a 'service animal' request.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id JOIN SpecialRequests sr ON b.booking_id = sr.booking_id WHERE sr.request_type = 'Service Animal';

natural_language_query: List all airports that are located on an island.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airports WHERE is_on_island = 1;

natural_language_query: Calculate the total revenue per flight.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number, SUM(t.price) as total_revenue FROM Flights f JOIN Tickets t ON f.flight_id = t.flight_id GROUP BY f.flight_number;

natural_language_query: Find the most common aircraft type for each airline.
sql_query: WITH RankedAircraft AS (SELECT al.name as airline, a.model, COUNT(*) as type_count, RANK() OVER (PARTITION BY al.name ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC) as rnk FROM Airlines al JOIN Flights f ON al.airline_id = f.airline_id JOIN Aircrafts a ON f.aircraft_id = a.aircraft_id GROUP BY al.name, a.model) SELECT airline, model, type_count FROM RankedAircraft WHERE rnk = 1;

natural_language_query: List all passengers who have booked a flight in the last hour.
sql_query: SELECT p.* FROM Passengers p JOIN Bookings b ON p.passenger_id = b.passenger_id WHERE b.booking_date > DATETIME('now', '-1 hour');

natural_language_query: Find the number of flights that have been affected by a security threat.
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM FlightDisruptions WHERE reason = 'Security Threat';

natural_language_query: Show the top 5 most profitable routes for each airline.
sql_query: WITH RouteProfits AS (SELECT f.airline_id, f.route_id, SUM(t.price) - SUM(c.cost) as profit, RANK() OVER (PARTITION BY f.airline_id ORDER BY (SUM(t.price) - SUM(c.cost)) DESC) as rnk FROM Flights f JOIN Tickets t ON f.flight_id = t.flight_id JOIN Costs c ON f.flight_id = c.flight_id GROUP BY f.airline_id, f.route_id) SELECT al.name, r.name, rp.profit FROM RouteProfits rp JOIN Airlines al ON rp.airline_id = al.airline_id JOIN Routes r ON rp.route_id = r.route_id WHERE rp.rnk <= 5;

natural_language_query: Find all aircraft that have Wi-Fi but do not have in-seat power.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Aircrafts WHERE aircraft_id IN (SELECT aircraft_id FROM Amenities WHERE type = 'Wi-Fi') AND aircraft_id NOT IN (SELECT aircraft_id FROM Amenities WHERE type = 'In-Seat Power');

natural_language_query: List all pilots who are qualified to be instructors but are not currently instructing.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Pilots WHERE can_be_instructor = 1 AND is_currently_instructing = 0;

natural_language_query: Calculate the average ticket price for flights departing in the morning vs. evening.
sql_query: SELECT CASE WHEN STRFTIME('%H', departure_time) < '12' THEN 'Morning' ELSE 'Evening' END as departure_period, AVG(t.price) FROM Flights f JOIN Tickets t ON f.flight_id = t.flight_id GROUP BY departure_period;

natural_language_query: Find the passenger who has flown the most segments in a single day.
sql_query: SELECT p.first_name, p.last_name, COUNT(*) as segments_in_day FROM Passengers p JOIN Bookings b ON p.passenger_id = b.passenger_id JOIN Flights f ON b.flight_id = f.flight_id WHERE DATE(f.departure_time) = '2023-12-01' GROUP BY p.passenger_id, DATE(f.departure_time) ORDER BY segments_in_day DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the 'status' of all flights that landed more than 24 hours ago to 'Archived'.
sql_query: UPDATE Flights SET status = 'Archived' WHERE status = 'Landed' AND arrival_time < DATETIME('now', '-1 day');

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have had a medical diversion.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE status = 'Diverted' AND diversion_reason = 'Medical Emergency';

natural_language_query: List all airports that have a dedicated fast-food court.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airports WHERE amenities LIKE '%Food Court%';

natural_language_query: Find the average number of days between a pilot's flights.
sql_query: WITH PilotFlights AS (SELECT pilot_id, departure_time, LAG(departure_time, 1) OVER (PARTITION BY pilot_id ORDER BY departure_time) as previous_flight_date FROM Crews c JOIN Flights f ON c.flight_id = f.flight_id) SELECT p.name, AVG(JULIANDAY(pf.departure_time) - JULIANDAY(pf.previous_flight_date)) FROM Pilots p JOIN PilotFlights pf ON p.pilot_id = pf.pilot_id WHERE pf.previous_flight_date IS NOT NULL GROUP BY p.name;

natural_language_query: Add a 'is_charter' flag to the Flights table.
sql_query: ALTER TABLE Flights ADD COLUMN is_charter BOOLEAN DEFAULT 0;

natural_language_query: Find all flights carrying cargo that requires refrigeration.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Cargo c ON f.flight_id = c.flight_id WHERE c.requires_refrigeration = 1;

natural_language_query: List all pilots who have a birthday in the current month.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Pilots WHERE STRFTIME('%m', date_of_birth) = STRFTIME('%m', 'now');

natural_language_query: Find the total number of passengers who have flown from 'JFK' to any airport in 'California'.
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT b.passenger_id) FROM Bookings b JOIN Flights f ON b.flight_id = f.flight_id JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id WHERE dep.iata_code = 'JFK' AND arr.state = 'California';

natural_language_query: Create a trigger to automatically assign a crew to a new flight based on availability.
sql_query: CREATE TRIGGER assign_crew_on_insert AFTER INSERT ON Flights FOR EACH ROW BEGIN INSERT INTO Crews (flight_id, pilot_id, copilot_id) VALUES (NEW.flight_id, (SELECT pilot_id FROM PilotAvailability WHERE is_available = 1 LIMIT 1), (SELECT copilot_id FROM CopilotAvailability WHERE is_available = 1 LIMIT 1)); END;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have experienced a lightning strike.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE flight_id IN (SELECT flight_id FROM FlightEvents WHERE event_type = 'Lightning Strike');

natural_language_query: List all maintenance events that were performed at a third-party facility.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Maintenance WHERE facility_type = 'Third-Party';

natural_language_query: Find the average number of loyalty points redeemed per reward.
sql_query: SELECT reward_type, AVG(points_cost) FROM LoyaltyRewards GROUP BY reward_type;

natural_language_query: Update the 'capacity' of an aircraft model.
sql_query: UPDATE AircraftModels SET capacity = 189 WHERE model_code = '737-800';

natural_language_query: Find all flights where the aircraft returned to the gate after pushback.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE flight_id IN (SELECT flight_id FROM FlightEvents WHERE event_type = 'Return to Gate');

natural_language_query: List all airports that have a children's nursery.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airports WHERE amenities LIKE '%Nursery%';

natural_language_query: Calculate the total number of flight hours logged for each aircraft model.
sql_query: SELECT a.model, a.manufacturer, SUM((strftime('%s', f.arrival_time) - strftime('%s', f.departure_time))/3600.0) as total_hours FROM Aircrafts a JOIN Flights f ON a.aircraft_id = f.aircraft_id GROUP BY a.model, a.manufacturer;

natural_language_query: Find the most common airport for diversions for each airline.
sql_query: WITH RankedDiversions AS (SELECT f.airline_id, f.diversion_airport_id, COUNT(*) as diversion_count, RANK() OVER (PARTITION BY f.airline_id ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC) as rnk FROM Flights f WHERE f.status = 'Diverted' GROUP BY f.airline_id, f.diversion_airport_id) SELECT al.name, ap.name, rd.diversion_count FROM RankedDiversions rd JOIN Airlines al ON rd.airline_id = al.airline_id JOIN Airports ap ON rd.diversion_airport_id = ap.airport_id WHERE rd.rnk = 1;

natural_language_query: List all passengers who have booked flights on more than 3 different airlines in the last year.
sql_query: SELECT p.first_name, p.last_name FROM Passengers p JOIN Bookings b ON p.passenger_id = b.passenger_id JOIN Flights f ON b.flight_id = f.flight_id WHERE f.departure_time > DATE('now', '-1 year') GROUP BY p.passenger_id HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT f.airline_id) > 3;

natural_language_query: Find the number of flights that have been cancelled for each day of the week.
sql_query: SELECT STRFTIME('%w', departure_time) as day_of_week, COUNT(*) as cancelled_flights FROM Flights WHERE status = 'Cancelled' GROUP BY day_of_week;

natural_language_query: Show the top 5 longest non-stop flights in the world.
sql_query: SELECT dep.name, arr.name, r.distance_km FROM Routes r JOIN Airports dep ON r.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON r.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id ORDER BY r.distance_km DESC LIMIT 5;

natural_language_query: Find all aircraft that have an average flight duration of more than 12 hours.
sql_query: SELECT a.registration FROM Aircrafts a JOIN (SELECT aircraft_id, AVG((strftime('%s', arrival_time) - strftime('%s', departure_time))/3600.0) as avg_duration FROM Flights GROUP BY aircraft_id) as flight_durations ON a.aircraft_id = flight_durations.aircraft_id WHERE flight_durations.avg_duration > 12;

natural_language_query: List all pilots who are certified to fly both Boeing and Airbus aircraft.
sql_query: SELECT p.name FROM Pilots p WHERE (SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT a.manufacturer) FROM Certifications c JOIN Aircrafts a ON c.aircraft_model = a.model WHERE c.pilot_id = p.pilot_id AND a.manufacturer IN ('Boeing', 'Airbus')) = 2;

natural_language_query: Calculate the average fare per kilometer for each airline.
sql_query: SELECT al.name, AVG(t.price / r.distance_km) as avg_fare_per_km FROM Airlines al JOIN Flights f ON al.airline_id = f.airline_id JOIN Tickets t ON f.flight_id = t.flight_id JOIN Routes r ON f.route_id = r.route_id GROUP BY al.name;

natural_language_query: Find the passenger who has spent the most on tickets in the last year.
sql_query: SELECT p.first_name, p.last_name, SUM(t.price) as total_spent FROM Passengers p JOIN Bookings b ON p.passenger_id = b.passenger_id JOIN Tickets t ON b.ticket_id = t.ticket_id JOIN Flights f ON b.flight_id = f.flight_id WHERE f.departure_time > DATE('now', '-1 year') GROUP BY p.passenger_id ORDER BY total_spent DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the 'on_time_record' for a pilot after a successful on-time flight.
sql_query: UPDATE Pilots SET on_time_flights = on_time_flights + 1, total_flights = total_flights + 1 WHERE pilot_id = (SELECT pilot_id FROM Crews WHERE flight_id = 1234);

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have had to dump fuel.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE flight_id IN (SELECT flight_id FROM FlightEvents WHERE event_type = 'Fuel Dump');

natural_language_query: List all airports that have a dedicated cargo apron.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airports WHERE amenities LIKE '%Cargo Apron%';

natural_language_query: Find the average number of passengers on flights that were delayed vs. on-time.
sql_query: SELECT status, AVG(pax_count) FROM Flights f JOIN (SELECT flight_id, COUNT(booking_id) as pax_count FROM Bookings GROUP BY flight_id) as flight_data ON f.flight_id = flight_data.flight_id WHERE status IN ('Delayed', 'On-time') GROUP BY status;

natural_language_query: Add a 'crew_base' location to the CrewMembers table.
sql_query: ALTER TABLE CrewMembers ADD COLUMN crew_base_iata VARCHAR(3);

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have transported a winning racehorse.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Cargo c ON f.flight_id = c.flight_id WHERE c.description LIKE '%racehorse%' AND c.notes LIKE '%winner%';

natural_language_query: List all pilots who have a perfect on-time record.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Pilots WHERE on_time_flights = total_flights AND total_flights > 0;

natural_language_query: Find the total number of passengers who have flown to a specific airport for the first time.
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM (SELECT passenger_id, MIN(f.departure_time) as first_flight_date FROM Bookings b JOIN Flights f ON b.flight_id = f.flight_id WHERE f.arrival_airport_id = 123 GROUP BY passenger_id);

natural_language_query: Create a view that shows all details of a booking, including passenger and flight info.
sql_query: CREATE VIEW FullBookingDetails AS SELECT b.booking_id, p.first_name, p.last_name, f.flight_number, dep.name as departure, arr.name as arrival, b.seat_number, t.class, t.price FROM Bookings b JOIN Passengers p ON b.passenger_id = p.passenger_id JOIN Flights f ON b.flight_id = f.flight_id JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id JOIN Tickets t ON b.ticket_id = t.ticket_id;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have a passenger who is a known travel blogger.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id JOIN Passengers p ON b.passenger_id = p.passenger_id WHERE p.is_travel_blogger = 1;

natural_language_query: List all maintenance events that involved replacing a tire.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Maintenance WHERE description LIKE '%tire replacement%';

natural_language_query: Find the average number of flights per day for each month.
sql_query: SELECT STRFTIME('%Y-%m', day) as month, AVG(flights_per_day) FROM (SELECT DATE(departure_time) as day, COUNT(*) as flights_per_day FROM Flights GROUP BY day) GROUP BY month;

natural_language_query: Update the 'status' of a runway to 'Closed for Maintenance'.
sql_query: UPDATE Runways SET is_operational = 0, status_notes = 'Closed for Maintenance' WHERE runway_id = 67;

natural_language_query: Find all flights where the captain is female and the first officer is male.
sql_query: SELECT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Crews c ON f.flight_id = c.flight_id JOIN Pilots captain ON c.pilot_id = captain.pilot_id JOIN Pilots fo ON c.copilot_id = fo.pilot_id WHERE captain.gender = 'F' AND fo.gender = 'M';

natural_language_query: List all airports that have a dedicated private jet terminal.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airports WHERE has_private_jet_terminal = 1;

natural_language_query: Calculate the total number of passengers who have flown on each airline alliance.
sql_query: SELECT al.alliance, COUNT(DISTINCT b.passenger_id) as total_passengers FROM Airlines al JOIN Flights f ON al.airline_id = f.airline_id JOIN Bookings b ON f.flight_id = b.flight_id WHERE al.alliance IS NOT NULL GROUP BY al.alliance;

natural_language_query: Find the most common aircraft used for flights to a specific country.
sql_query: SELECT a.model, a.manufacturer, COUNT(*) as flight_count FROM Aircrafts a JOIN Flights f ON a.aircraft_id = f.aircraft_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id WHERE arr.country = 'Australia' GROUP BY a.model, a.manufacturer ORDER BY flight_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: List all passengers who have booked a flight with a connection in a different country.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT p.* FROM Passengers p JOIN Tickets t ON p.passenger_id = t.passenger_id JOIN Flights f1 ON t.flight1_id = f1.flight_id JOIN Flights f2 ON t.flight2_id = f2.flight_id JOIN Airports ap1_arr ON f1.arrival_airport_id = ap1_arr.airport_id JOIN Airports ap2_dep ON f2.departure_airport_id = ap2_dep.airport_id WHERE ap1_arr.country != ap2_dep.country;

natural_language_query: Find the number of flights that have been delayed for each reason category.
sql_query: SELECT reason_category, COUNT(*) FROM Delays GROUP BY reason_category;

natural_language_query: Show the top 5 airports with the best on-time departure performance.
sql_query: SELECT ap.name, (COUNT(CASE WHEN f.status = 'On-time' THEN 1 END) * 100.0) / COUNT(f.flight_id) as on_time_departure_pct FROM Airports ap JOIN Flights f ON ap.airport_id = f.departure_airport_id GROUP BY ap.name ORDER BY on_time_departure_pct DESC LIMIT 5;

natural_language_query: Find all aircraft that have never had a major maintenance check.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Aircrafts WHERE aircraft_id NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT aircraft_id FROM Maintenance WHERE is_major_check = 1);

natural_language_query: List all pilots who are certified to fly more than one type of wide-body aircraft.
sql_query: SELECT p.name, COUNT(DISTINCT a.model) as wide_body_certs FROM Pilots p JOIN Certifications c ON p.pilot_id = c.pilot_id JOIN Aircrafts a ON c.aircraft_model = a.model WHERE a.body_type = 'Wide-body' GROUP BY p.pilot_id HAVING wide_body_certs > 1;

natural_language_query: Calculate the average ticket price per route.
sql_query: SELECT r.name, AVG(t.price) as avg_ticket_price FROM Routes r JOIN Flights f ON r.route_id = f.route_id JOIN Tickets t ON f.flight_id = t.flight_id GROUP BY r.name;

natural_language_query: Find the passenger who has flown on the most number of different airlines.
sql_query: SELECT p.first_name, p.last_name, COUNT(DISTINCT f.airline_id) as unique_airlines_flown FROM Passengers p JOIN Bookings b ON p.passenger_id = b.passenger_id JOIN Flights f ON b.flight_id = f.flight_id GROUP BY p.passenger_id ORDER BY unique_airlines_flown DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the 'notes' for a specific maintenance event.
sql_query: UPDATE Maintenance SET notes = 'Replaced part XYZ, tested OK.' WHERE maintenance_id = 9876;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that were cancelled on a major holiday.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights f JOIN Holidays h ON DATE(f.departure_time) = h.date WHERE f.status = 'Cancelled';

natural_language_query: List all airports that have a train station directly connected to them.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airports WHERE has_direct_train_link = 1;

natural_language_query: Find the average number of flights per pilot.
sql_query: SELECT AVG(flight_count) FROM (SELECT pilot_id, COUNT(*) as flight_count FROM Crews GROUP BY pilot_id);

natural_language_query: Add a 'date_of_birth' column to the CrewMembers table.
sql_query: ALTER TABLE CrewMembers ADD COLUMN date_of_birth DATE;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have transported dangerous goods.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT f.flight_number FROM Flights f JOIN Cargo c ON f.flight_id = c.flight_id WHERE c.is_dangerous_goods = 1;

natural_language_query: List all pilots who are over the age of 60.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Pilots WHERE (CAST(strftime('%Y', 'now') AS INTEGER) - CAST(strftime('%Y', date_of_birth) AS INTEGER)) > 60;

natural_language_query: Find the total number of passengers who have flown to or from a specific continent.
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT b.passenger_id) FROM Bookings b JOIN Flights f ON b.flight_id = f.flight_id JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id WHERE dep.continent = 'Europe' OR arr.continent = 'Europe';

natural_language_query: Create a trigger to prevent booking a passenger on two flights that have overlapping times.
sql_query: CREATE TRIGGER prevent_double_booking BEFORE INSERT ON Bookings FOR EACH ROW BEGIN SELECT RAISE(ABORT, 'Passenger is already booked on an overlapping flight') FROM Bookings b JOIN Flights f ON b.flight_id = f.flight_id WHERE b.passenger_id = NEW.passenger_id AND (SELECT departure_time FROM Flights WHERE flight_id = NEW.flight_id) < f.arrival_time AND (SELECT arrival_time FROM Flights WHERE flight_id = NEW.flight_id) > f.departure_time; END;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that have had a bird strike reported.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE flight_id IN (SELECT flight_id FROM FlightEvents WHERE event_type = 'Bird Strike');

natural_language_query: List all maintenance facilities owned by a specific airline.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM MaintenanceFacilities WHERE owner_airline_id = 1;

natural_language_query: Find the average number of loyalty points held by passengers in each loyalty tier.
sql_query: SELECT loyalty_tier, AVG(loyalty_points) FROM Passengers WHERE loyalty_tier IS NOT NULL GROUP BY loyalty_tier;

natural_language_query: Find all maintenance facilities for 'Southwest Airlines' located in 'Berlin'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM MaintenanceFacilities WHERE owner_airline_id = (SELECT airline_id FROM Airlines WHERE name = 'Southwest Airlines') AND location LIKE '%Berlin%';

natural_language_query: List all flights that are currently 'Diverted'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE status = 'Diverted';

natural_language_query: Add a new aircraft: a 'Cessna SkyCourier' with capacity for 97 and a range of 3226 km.
sql_query: INSERT INTO Aircrafts (manufacturer, model, capacity, range_km) VALUES ('Cessna', 'SkyCourier', 97, 3226);

natural_language_query: Find the average number of flights per day for 'Air France'.
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(flight_id) / CAST(JULIANDAY(MAX(departure_time)) - JULIANDAY(MIN(departure_time)) + 1 AS INTEGER) AS avg_flights_per_day FROM Flights WHERE airline_id = (SELECT airline_id FROM Airlines WHERE name = 'Air France');

natural_language_query: List all pilots who fly for 'British Airways'.
sql_query: SELECT p.* FROM Pilots p JOIN Flights f ON p.pilot_id = f.pilot_id JOIN Airlines al ON f.airline_id = al.airline_id WHERE al.name = 'British Airways';

natural_language_query: Add a new aircraft: a 'Boeing 787 Dreamliner' with capacity for 264 and a range of 13437 km.
sql_query: INSERT INTO Aircrafts (manufacturer, model, capacity, range_km) VALUES ('Boeing', '787 Dreamliner', 264, 13437);

natural_language_query: Count the number of airports in each country in South America.
sql_query: SELECT country, COUNT(*) FROM Airports WHERE continent = 'South America' GROUP BY country;

natural_language_query: Count the number of airports in each country in Oceania.
sql_query: SELECT country, COUNT(*) FROM Airports WHERE continent = 'Oceania' GROUP BY country;

natural_language_query: Find the most common flight route (departure-arrival airport pair).
sql_query: SELECT dep.name as departure_airport, arr.name as arrival_airport, COUNT(*) as route_count FROM Flights f JOIN Airports dep ON f.departure_airport_id = dep.airport_id JOIN Airports arr ON f.arrival_airport_id = arr.airport_id GROUP BY departure_airport, arrival_airport ORDER BY route_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Find all flights that reported a 'Technical Issue'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE flight_id IN (SELECT flight_id FROM FlightEvents WHERE event_type = 'Technical Issue');

natural_language_query: Find all flights from 'DEN' to 'SFO'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE departure_airport_id = (SELECT airport_id FROM Airports WHERE iata_code = 'DEN') AND arrival_airport_id = (SELECT airport_id FROM Airports WHERE iata_code = 'SFO');

natural_language_query: Add a new aircraft: a 'Boeing 737' with capacity for 130 and a range of 10590 km.
sql_query: INSERT INTO Aircrafts (manufacturer, model, capacity, range_km) VALUES ('Boeing', '737', 130, 10590);

natural_language_query: Find all maintenance facilities for 'KLM' located in 'Toronto'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM MaintenanceFacilities WHERE owner_airline_id = (SELECT airline_id FROM Airlines WHERE name = 'KLM') AND location LIKE '%Toronto%';

natural_language_query: Find aircraft with a capacity of more than 141 passengers.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Aircrafts WHERE capacity > 141;

natural_language_query: Find all flights from 'JFK' to 'LHR'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE departure_airport_id = (SELECT airport_id FROM Airports WHERE iata_code = 'JFK') AND arrival_airport_id = (SELECT airport_id FROM Airports WHERE iata_code = 'LHR');

natural_language_query: Find all flights from 'CDG' to 'LHR'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE departure_airport_id = (SELECT airport_id FROM Airports WHERE iata_code = 'CDG') AND arrival_airport_id = (SELECT airport_id FROM Airports WHERE iata_code = 'LHR');

natural_language_query: List all pilots between the ages of 35 and 50.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Pilots WHERE (CAST(strftime('%Y', 'now') AS INTEGER) - CAST(strftime('%Y', date_of_birth) AS INTEGER)) BETWEEN 35 AND 50;

natural_language_query: Find all bookings made by 'David Brown'.
sql_query: SELECT b.* FROM Bookings b JOIN Passengers p ON b.passenger_id = p.passenger_id WHERE p.first_name = 'David' AND p.last_name = 'Brown';

natural_language_query: Which aircraft has pilot 'Jessica Wilson' flown the most?
sql_query: SELECT a.manufacturer, a.model, COUNT(*) as flight_count FROM Aircrafts a JOIN Flights f ON a.aircraft_id = f.aircraft_id JOIN Pilots p ON f.pilot_id = p.pilot_id WHERE p.first_name = 'Jessica' AND p.last_name = 'Wilson' GROUP BY a.aircraft_id ORDER BY flight_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: What is the average flight duration?
sql_query: SELECT AVG(strftime('%s', arrival_time) - strftime('%s', departure_time)) / 3600 FROM Flights;

natural_language_query: How many passengers are in the 'Silver' loyalty tier?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Passengers WHERE loyalty_tier = 'Silver';

natural_language_query: Update the status of flight 'AA9407' to 'Delayed'.
sql_query: UPDATE Flights SET status = 'Delayed' WHERE flight_number = 'AA9407';

natural_language_query: Calculate the total number of passengers arriving at 'LHR'.
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(b.passenger_id) FROM Bookings b JOIN Flights f ON b.flight_id = f.flight_id JOIN Airports a ON f.arrival_airport_id = a.airport_id WHERE a.iata_code = 'LHR';

natural_language_query: How many passengers are in the 'Bronze' loyalty tier?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Passengers WHERE loyalty_tier = 'Bronze';

natural_language_query: Find all flights that reported a 'Bird Strike'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE flight_id IN (SELECT flight_id FROM FlightEvents WHERE event_type = 'Bird Strike');

natural_language_query: Count the number of airports in each country in Asia.
sql_query: SELECT country, COUNT(*) FROM Airports WHERE continent = 'Asia' GROUP BY country;

natural_language_query: List all airports in 'Australia'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Airports WHERE country = 'Australia';

natural_language_query: Find all bookings made by 'Jane Doe'.
sql_query: SELECT b.* FROM Bookings b JOIN Passengers p ON b.passenger_id = p.passenger_id WHERE p.first_name = 'Jane' AND p.last_name = 'Doe';

natural_language_query: List all airlines that fly to 'Japan'.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT al.name FROM Airlines al JOIN Flights f ON al.airline_id = f.airline_id JOIN Airports a ON f.arrival_airport_id = a.airport_id WHERE a.country = 'Japan';

natural_language_query: Find the top 5 airlines with the most flights.
sql_query: SELECT al.name, COUNT(f.flight_id) AS flight_count FROM Airlines al JOIN Flights f ON al.airline_id = f.airline_id GROUP BY al.name ORDER BY flight_count DESC LIMIT 5;

natural_language_query: How many flights were cancelled in the year 2025?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Flights WHERE status = 'Cancelled' AND strftime('%Y', departure_time) = '2025';

natural_language_query: Delete passenger with ID 8919.
sql_query: DELETE FROM Passengers WHERE passenger_id = 8919;

natural_language_query: How many passengers are in the 'Gold' loyalty tier?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Passengers WHERE loyalty_tier = 'Gold';

natural_language_query: Update the status of flight 'AA2527' to 'Arrived'.
sql_query: UPDATE Flights SET status = 'Arrived' WHERE flight_number = 'AA2527';

natural_language_query: List all flights that are currently 'Boarding'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE status = 'Boarding';

natural_language_query: Find all flights that reported a 'Severe Turbulence'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE flight_id IN (SELECT flight_id FROM FlightEvents WHERE event_type = 'Severe Turbulence');

natural_language_query: List all flights that are currently 'On Time'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE status = 'On Time';

natural_language_query: List all flights that are currently 'Scheduled'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Flights WHERE status = 'Scheduled';

natural_language_query: Find all aircraft made by 'Bombardier'.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM Aircrafts WHERE manufacturer = 'Bombardier';

natural_language_query: Add a new aircraft: a 'Embraer E195' with capacity for 310 and a range of 9743 km.
sql_query: INSERT INTO Aircrafts (manufacturer, model, capacity, range_km) VALUES ('Embraer', 'E195', 310, 9743);

natural_language_query: Which aircraft has pilot 'Sarah Moore' flown the most?
