sql_query: SELECT * FROM courses WHERE credits = 2 AND department = 'Art';

natural_language_query: Add a new instructor 'Jane Austen' to the 'English' department.
sql_query: INSERT INTO instructors (first_name, last_name, department) VALUES ('Jane', 'Austen', 'English');

natural_language_query: How many students were enrolled in each day of the week?
sql_query: SELECT strftime('%w', enrollment_date) as day, COUNT(*) FROM students GROUP BY day;

natural_language_query: Delete all enrollments with a grade of 'B+'.
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE grade = 'B+';

natural_language_query: Find the students who are enrolled in the fewest courses.
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id GROUP BY s.student_id ORDER BY COUNT(e.course_id) ASC LIMIT 5;

natural_language_query: Change the course name of ID 501 to 'Senior Thesis'.
sql_query: UPDATE courses SET course_name = 'Senior Thesis' WHERE course_id = 501;

natural_language_query: List all instructors and the average grade of students in their department.
sql_query: SELECT i.first_name, i.last_name, (SELECT AVG(e.grade) FROM enrollments e JOIN students s ON e.student_id = s.student_id WHERE s.major = i.department) as avg_grade FROM instructors i;

natural_language_query: Add a new student 'Frank Lloyd Wright' with major 'Architecture' enrolled on '1887-01-01'.
sql_query: INSERT INTO students (first_name, last_name, major, enrollment_date) VALUES ('Frank', 'Lloyd Wright', 'Architecture', '1887-01-01');

natural_language_query: What is the most common first letter for a student's last name?
sql_query: SELECT SUBSTR(last_name, 1, 1) as first_letter FROM students GROUP BY first_letter ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Remove all students whose first name is shorter than 3 letters.
sql_query: DELETE FROM students WHERE LENGTH(first_name) < 3;

natural_language_query: Find the student who has the lowest average grade.
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id GROUP BY s.student_id ORDER BY AVG(e.grade) ASC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the credits for all courses to be no more than 5.
sql_query: UPDATE courses SET credits = 5 WHERE credits > 5;

natural_language_query: List all students who enrolled in a month with 31 days.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM students WHERE strftime('%m', enrollment_date) IN ('01', '03', '05', '07', '08', '10', '12');

natural_language_query: Enroll all 'English' majors in 'Shakespeare' (ID 210) for 'Spring 2025'.
sql_query: INSERT INTO enrollments (student_id, course_id, semester) SELECT student_id, 210, 'Spring 2025' FROM students WHERE major = 'English';

natural_language_query: How many students does the average department have?
sql_query: SELECT AVG(student_count) FROM (SELECT COUNT(*) as student_count FROM students GROUP BY major);

natural_language_query: Delete all enrollments for instructors who have left the university (conceptual).
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE course_id IN (SELECT course_id FROM courses c WHERE c.department IN (SELECT department FROM instructors WHERE status = 'Inactive'));

natural_language_query: Find all courses that are only offered in the 'Fall'.
sql_query: SELECT c.course_name FROM courses c JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id GROUP BY c.course_id HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN e.semester LIKE 'Spring%' THEN 1 ELSE NULL END) = 0;

natural_language_query: Change the last name for all instructors in the 'Physics' department to 'Physicist'.
sql_query: UPDATE instructors SET last_name = 'Physicist' WHERE department = 'Physics';

natural_language_query: List all students who have taken a course with instructor 'Alan Turing'.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT s.* FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id WHERE c.department = (SELECT department FROM instructors WHERE first_name = 'Alan' AND last_name = 'Turing');

natural_language_query: Add a new course 'Number Theory' with 3 credits to the 'Mathematics' department.
sql_query: INSERT INTO courses (course_name, department, credits) VALUES ('Number Theory', 'Mathematics', 3);

natural_language_query: What percentage of courses are 3 credits?
sql_query: SELECT (COUNT(*) * 100.0 / (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM courses)) FROM courses WHERE credits = 3;

natural_language_query: Remove all students who have only 'F' grades.
sql_query: DELETE FROM students WHERE student_id IN (SELECT student_id FROM enrollments GROUP BY student_id HAVING MAX(grade) = 'F');

natural_language_query: Find the department that has the most diverse student first names.
sql_query: SELECT major FROM students GROUP BY major ORDER BY COUNT(DISTINCT first_name) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the grades for 'Intro to Programming' to be Pass/Fail (P/F).
sql_query: UPDATE enrollments SET grade = 'P' WHERE course_id = (SELECT course_id FROM courses WHERE course_name = 'Intro to Programming') AND grade IN ('A', 'B', 'C', 'D');

natural_language_query: List the names of students who are taking at least one course from the 'Art' and 'Science' departments.
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name FROM students s WHERE EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM enrollments e JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id WHERE e.student_id = s.student_id AND c.department = 'Art') AND EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM enrollments e JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id WHERE e.student_id = s.student_id AND c.department LIKE '%Science%');

natural_language_query: Add a new instructor 'Confucius' to the 'Philosophy' department.
sql_query: INSERT INTO instructors (first_name, last_name, department) VALUES ('Confucius', '', 'Philosophy');

natural_language_query: How many students enrolled on a Tuesday?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM students WHERE strftime('%w', enrollment_date) = '2';

natural_language_query: Delete all courses that have not been offered in 3 years.
sql_query: DELETE FROM courses WHERE course_id NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT course_id FROM enrollments WHERE semester > '2022');

natural_language_query: Find the student who has taken courses with the most instructors.
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id GROUP BY s.student_id ORDER BY COUNT(DISTINCT c.department) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Change the major of students to 'STEM' if their major is 'Physics', 'Chemistry', or 'Biology'.
sql_query: UPDATE students SET major = 'STEM' WHERE major IN ('Physics', 'Chemistry', 'Biology');

natural_language_query: List all pairs of courses that are often taken together in the same semester.
sql_query: SELECT c1.course_name, c2.course_name FROM enrollments e1 JOIN enrollments e2 ON e1.student_id = e2.student_id AND e1.semester = e2.semester AND e1.course_id < e2.course_id JOIN courses c1 ON e1.course_id = c1.course_id JOIN courses c2 ON e2.course_id = c2.course_id GROUP BY c1.course_name, c2.course_name ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 10;

natural_language_query: Add a new enrollment for student 51 in course 102 for 'Spring 2025'.
sql_query: INSERT INTO enrollments (student_id, course_id, semester) VALUES (51, 102, 'Spring 2025');

natural_language_query: What is the distribution of students by the first letter of their last name?
sql_query: SELECT SUBSTR(last_name, 1, 1) as initial, COUNT(*) FROM students GROUP BY initial;

natural_language_query: Remove all instructors who teach in a department that has only one course.
sql_query: DELETE FROM instructors WHERE department IN (SELECT department FROM courses GROUP BY department HAVING COUNT(*) = 1);

natural_language_query: Find the most lenient course (highest average grade).
sql_query: SELECT c.course_name FROM courses c JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id GROUP BY c.course_id ORDER BY AVG(e.grade) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the last name of student 44 to 'Washington'.
sql_query: UPDATE students SET last_name = 'Washington' WHERE student_id = 44;

natural_language_query: List all students who are not taking any courses in their major's department.
sql_query: SELECT s.* FROM students s WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM enrollments e JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id WHERE e.student_id = s.student_id AND c.department = s.major);

natural_language_query: Create a new 'Dance' department and add an instructor 'Martha Graham' to it.
sql_query: INSERT INTO instructors (first_name, last_name, department) VALUES ('Martha', 'Graham', 'Dance');

natural_language_query: How many characters is the shortest instructor first name?
sql_query: SELECT MIN(LENGTH(first_name)) FROM instructors;

natural_language_query: Delete all enrollments for students whose last name is 'Jones'.
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE student_id IN (SELECT student_id FROM students WHERE last_name = 'Jones');

natural_language_query: Find the student who has the most consistent grades (lowest standard deviation).
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id GROUP BY s.student_id ORDER BY STDEV(e.grade) ASC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Demote all 4-credit courses in the 'Business' department to 3 credits.
sql_query: UPDATE courses SET credits = 3 WHERE department = 'Business' AND credits = 4;

natural_language_query: List all students who have never failed a course (grade 'F').
sql_query: SELECT s.* FROM students s WHERE s.student_id NOT IN (SELECT student_id FROM enrollments WHERE grade = 'F');

natural_language_query: Add a new student 'Vincent van Gogh' majoring in 'Art' enrolled on '1888-02-20'.
sql_query: INSERT INTO students (first_name, last_name, major, enrollment_date) VALUES ('Vincent', 'van Gogh', 'Art', '1888-02-20');

natural_language_query: What's the student-to-course ratio?
sql_query: SELECT (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM students) * 1.0 / (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM courses);

natural_language_query: Remove any course that has 'Final' in its title.
sql_query: DELETE FROM courses WHERE course_name LIKE '%Final%';

natural_language_query: Find the student(s) who enrolled on the same day as student ID 1.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM students WHERE enrollment_date = (SELECT enrollment_date FROM students WHERE student_id = 1) AND student_id != 1;

natural_language_query: Update all 'B-' grades to 'B'.
sql_query: UPDATE enrollments SET grade = 'B' WHERE grade = 'B-';

natural_language_query: List all instructors who teach in a department with more than 50 students.
sql_query: SELECT i.* FROM instructors i WHERE i.department IN (SELECT major FROM students GROUP BY major HAVING COUNT(*) > 50);

natural_language_query: Add a new enrollment for student 2 for every course in the 'Art' department for 'Fall 2025'.
sql_query: INSERT INTO enrollments (student_id, course_id, semester) SELECT 2, course_id, 'Fall 2025' FROM courses WHERE department = 'Art';

natural_language_query: How many students have a first name that is also a last name in the table?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM students s1 WHERE EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM students s2 WHERE s1.first_name = s2.last_name);

natural_language_query: Delete all enrollments from April 1st of any year.
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE strftime('%m-%d', '2000-' || semester) = '04-01';

natural_language_query: Find the department with the shortest average instructor last name.
sql_query: SELECT department FROM instructors GROUP BY department ORDER BY AVG(LENGTH(last_name)) ASC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Switch the majors of student 15 and student 25.
sql_query: UPDATE students SET major = CASE student_id WHEN 15 THEN (SELECT major FROM students WHERE student_id = 25) WHEN 25 THEN (SELECT major FROM students WHERE student_id = 15) END WHERE student_id IN (15, 25);

natural_language_query: List all students who are not taking any 1-credit courses.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM students s WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM enrollments e JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id WHERE e.student_id = s.student_id AND c.credits = 1);

natural_language_query: Add a new instructor 'Copernicus' to the 'Astronomy' department.
sql_query: INSERT INTO instructors (first_name, last_name, department) VALUES ('Nicolaus', 'Copernicus', 'Astronomy');

natural_language_query: What is the total number of credit hours being taken by 'Computer Science' majors in 'Fall 2023'?
sql_query: SELECT SUM(c.credits) FROM courses c JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = c.course_id JOIN students s ON e.student_id = s.student_id WHERE e.semester = 'Fall 2023' AND s.major = 'Computer Science';

natural_language_query: Delete any student who has 'test' in their first name.
sql_query: DELETE FROM students WHERE first_name LIKE '%test%';

natural_language_query: Find the instructor who teaches the course with the fewest students.
sql_query: SELECT i.* FROM instructors i JOIN courses c ON i.department = c.department JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = c.course_id GROUP BY e.course_id ORDER BY COUNT(e.student_id) ASC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the enrollment date for all 'Art' majors to the first of their enrollment year.
sql_query: UPDATE students SET enrollment_date = strftime('%Y-01-01', enrollment_date) WHERE major = 'Art';

natural_language_query: List all courses that have no students from their own department enrolled.
sql_query: SELECT c.* FROM courses c WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM enrollments e JOIN students s ON e.student_id = s.student_id WHERE e.course_id = c.course_id AND s.major = c.department);

natural_language_query: Add a new student 'Dennis Ritchie' with major 'Computer Science' enrolled on '1970-01-01'.
sql_query: INSERT INTO students (first_name, last_name, major, enrollment_date) VALUES ('Dennis', 'Ritchie', 'Computer Science', '1970-01-01');

natural_language_query: How many enrollments have a grade of 'C' or 'C-'?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM enrollments WHERE grade IN ('C', 'C-');

natural_language_query: Delete all enrollments that are for a student who has withdrawn (conceptual).
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE student_id IN (SELECT student_id FROM students WHERE status = 'Withdrawn');

natural_language_query: Find the students who have taken both 'Intro to Psychology' and 'Abnormal Psychology'.
sql_query: SELECT s.* FROM students s JOIN enrollments e1 ON s.student_id = e1.student_id JOIN courses c1 ON e1.course_id = c1.course_id JOIN enrollments e2 ON s.student_id = e2.student_id JOIN courses c2 ON e2.course_id = c2.course_id WHERE c1.course_name = 'Intro to Psychology' AND c2.course_name = 'Abnormal Psychology';

natural_language_query: Change the department of all instructors with last name 'Smith' to 'General Science'.
sql_query: UPDATE instructors SET department = 'General Science' WHERE last_name = 'Smith';

natural_language_query: List the student who has been enrolled for the shortest time.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM students ORDER BY enrollment_date DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Add a new course 'Ethics' with 3 credits to the 'Philosophy' department.
sql_query: INSERT INTO courses (course_name, department, credits) VALUES ('Ethics', 'Philosophy', 3);

natural_language_query: What is the average length of an instructor's first name?
sql_query: SELECT AVG(LENGTH(first_name)) FROM instructors;

natural_language_query: Remove any student with an ID below 10.
sql_query: DELETE FROM students WHERE student_id < 10;

natural_language_query: Find the prerequisite for 'Calculus II' (conceptual).
sql_query: SELECT prerequisite_course_name FROM prerequisites WHERE course_name = 'Calculus II';

natural_language_query: Give all 'Art' majors an 'A' in 'Art History'.
sql_query: UPDATE enrollments SET grade = 'A' WHERE course_id = (SELECT course_id FROM courses WHERE course_name = 'Art History') AND student_id IN (SELECT student_id FROM students WHERE major = 'Art');

natural_language_query: List all instructors and the number of courses they teach (based on department).
sql_query: SELECT i.first_name, i.last_name, COUNT(c.course_id) FROM instructors i JOIN courses c ON i.department = c.department GROUP BY i.instructor_id;

natural_language_query: Add a new instructor 'Linus Torvalds' to the 'Computer Science' department.
sql_query: INSERT INTO instructors (first_name, last_name, department) VALUES ('Linus', 'Torvalds', 'Computer Science');

natural_language_query: How many students have a last name that is also a first name in the table?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT s1.student_id) FROM students s1 JOIN students s2 ON s1.last_name = s2.first_name;

natural_language_query: Delete all courses with no enrollments.
sql_query: DELETE FROM courses WHERE course_id NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT course_id FROM enrollments);

natural_language_query: Find the major with the lowest average grade.
sql_query: SELECT s.major FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id GROUP BY s.major ORDER BY AVG(e.grade) ASC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Halve the credits for all courses in the 'Physical Education' department.
sql_query: UPDATE courses SET credits = credits / 2 WHERE department = 'Physical Education';

natural_language_query: List all students who are only enrolled in 4-credit courses.
sql_query: SELECT s.* FROM students s WHERE s.student_id NOT IN (SELECT e.student_id FROM enrollments e JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id WHERE c.credits != 4);

natural_language_query: Add a new student 'Bjarne Stroustrup' with major 'Computer Science' enrolled on '1979-01-01'.
sql_query: INSERT INTO students (first_name, last_name, major, enrollment_date) VALUES ('Bjarne', 'Stroustrup', 'Computer Science', '1979-01-01');

natural_language_query: What is the total number of students whose last name starts with a consonant?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM students WHERE SUBSTR(last_name, 1, 1) NOT IN ('A', 'E', 'I', 'O', 'U');

natural_language_query: Remove all enrollments from students majoring in 'History'.
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE student_id IN (SELECT student_id FROM students WHERE major = 'History');

natural_language_query: Find the instructor who teaches in the department with the most students.
sql_query: SELECT i.* FROM instructors i WHERE i.department = (SELECT major FROM students GROUP BY major ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1);

natural_language_query: Update the semester for all of student 5's enrollments to 'Leave of Absence'.
sql_query: UPDATE enrollments SET semester = 'Leave of Absence' WHERE student_id = 5;

natural_language_query: List all courses and the number of instructors in their department.
sql_query: SELECT c.course_name, (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM instructors i WHERE i.department = c.department) as instructor_count FROM courses c;

natural_language_query: Add a 1-credit 'Yoga' course to the 'Health' department.
sql_query: INSERT INTO courses (course_name, department, credits) VALUES ('Yoga', 'Health', 1);

natural_language_query: How many students have a first name that is a month name?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM students WHERE first_name IN ('January', 'April', 'May', 'June', 'July');

natural_language_query: Delete all students who enrolled on a holiday (conceptual).
sql_query: DELETE FROM students WHERE enrollment_date IN ('2023-01-01', '2023-07-04', '2023-12-25');

natural_language_query: Find the most popular department (most students).
sql_query: SELECT major FROM students GROUP BY major ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Give a 10% credit penalty (conceptual) to all courses in the 'Philosophy' department.
sql_query: UPDATE courses SET credits = credits * 0.9 WHERE department = 'Philosophy';

natural_language_query: List all students who are taking less than 12 credits in 'Fall 2023'.
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id WHERE e.semester = 'Fall 2023' GROUP BY s.student_id HAVING SUM(c.credits) < 12;

natural_language_query: Add a new student 'Euclid' with major 'Mathematics' enrolled on '300-01-01' BC.
sql_query: INSERT INTO students (first_name, last_name, major, enrollment_date) VALUES ('Euclid', '', 'Mathematics', '-0300-01-01');

natural_language_query: What is the ratio of instructors to courses?
sql_query: SELECT (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM instructors) * 1.0 / (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM courses);

natural_language_query: Remove all enrollments for courses that have 'Advanced' in the name.
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE course_id IN (SELECT course_id FROM courses WHERE course_name LIKE '%Advanced%');

natural_language_query: Find pairs of students who have taken the exact same set of courses.
sql_query: SELECT s1.first_name, s1.last_name, s2.first_name, s2.last_name FROM (SELECT student_id, GROUP_CONCAT(course_id ORDER BY course_id) as courses FROM enrollments GROUP BY student_id) t1 JOIN (SELECT student_id, GROUP_CONCAT(course_id ORDER BY course_id) as courses FROM enrollments GROUP BY student_id) t2 ON t1.courses = t2.courses AND t1.student_id < t2.student_id JOIN students s1 ON t1.student_id = s1.student_id JOIN students s2 ON t2.student_id = s2.student_id;

natural_language_query: Update the enrollment date of student 41 to be the last day of the month.
sql_query: UPDATE students SET enrollment_date = date(enrollment_date, 'start of month', '+1 month', '-1 day') WHERE student_id = 41;

natural_language_query: List all courses that are only taught by one instructor (conceptual).
sql_query: SELECT c.course_name FROM courses c JOIN instructors i ON c.department = i.department GROUP BY c.course_id HAVING COUNT(i.instructor_id) = 1;

natural_language_query: Add a new instructor 'Pythagoras' to the 'Mathematics' department.
sql_query: INSERT INTO instructors (first_name, last_name, department) VALUES ('Pythagoras', '', 'Mathematics');

natural_language_query: How many students were enrolled per year?
sql_query: SELECT strftime('%Y', enrollment_date) as year, COUNT(*) FROM students GROUP BY year;

natural_language_query: Delete all grades that are 'A+'.
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE grade = 'A+';

natural_language_query: Find the student with the most 'C' grades.
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id WHERE e.grade = 'C' GROUP BY s.student_id ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Change the department of 'Calculus III' to 'Applied Mathematics'.
sql_query: UPDATE courses SET department = 'Applied Mathematics' WHERE course_name = 'Calculus III';

natural_language_query: List all students whose major department has more than 5 courses.
sql_query: SELECT s.* FROM students s WHERE s.major IN (SELECT department FROM courses GROUP BY department HAVING COUNT(*) > 5);

natural_language_query: Add a new student 'Frida Kahlo' with major 'Art' enrolled in 1922.
sql_query: INSERT INTO students (first_name, last_name, major, enrollment_date) VALUES ('Frida', 'Kahlo', 'Art', '1922-01-01');

natural_language_query: What is the average number of courses in a 'Science' department?
sql_query: SELECT AVG(course_count) FROM (SELECT COUNT(*) as course_count FROM courses WHERE department LIKE '%Science%' GROUP BY department);

natural_language_query: Archive (delete) all enrollments from 2021.
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE semester LIKE '%2021';

natural_language_query: Find the instructor who teaches the course with the lowest enrollment.
sql_query: SELECT i.* FROM instructors i JOIN courses c ON i.department = c.department JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id GROUP BY e.course_id ORDER BY COUNT(e.student_id) ASC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the last name of all students named 'Jessica' to 'Jess'.
sql_query: UPDATE students SET first_name = 'Jess' WHERE first_name = 'Jessica';

natural_language_query: List all courses that have a student and an instructor with the same first name enrolled/teaching.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT c.course_name FROM courses c JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id JOIN students s ON e.student_id = s.student_id JOIN instructors i ON c.department = i.department WHERE s.first_name = i.first_name;

natural_language_query: Add a new course 'Metaphysics' to the 'Philosophy' department with 3 credits.
sql_query: INSERT INTO courses (course_name, department, credits) VALUES ('Metaphysics', 'Philosophy', 3);

natural_language_query: How many students have a last name shorter than 4 letters?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM students WHERE LENGTH(last_name) < 4;

natural_language_query: Delete all students who have no enrollments in the current year (2025).
sql_query: DELETE FROM students WHERE student_id NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT student_id FROM enrollments WHERE semester LIKE '%2025');

natural_language_query: Find the major with the most consistent grades (smallest standard deviation).
sql_query: SELECT s.major FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id GROUP BY s.major ORDER BY STDEV(e.grade) ASC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Standardize instructor first names to be all uppercase.
sql_query: UPDATE instructors SET first_name = UPPER(first_name);

natural_language_query: List all students who are taking a course in the 'Computer Science' department but are not 'Computer Science' majors.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT s.* FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id WHERE c.department = 'Computer Science' AND s.major != 'Computer Science';

natural_language_query: Add a new student 'Marie Curie' with major 'Physics' enrolled on '1891-11-05'.
sql_query: INSERT INTO students (first_name, last_name, major, enrollment_date) VALUES ('Marie', 'Curie', 'Physics', '1891-11-05');

natural_language_query: What is the most common day of the month for enrollments?
sql_query: SELECT strftime('%d', enrollment_date) as day, COUNT(*) as count FROM students GROUP BY day ORDER BY count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Remove all 5-credit courses.
sql_query: DELETE FROM courses WHERE credits = 5;

natural_language_query: Find the student who has the highest total credits from all their courses.
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id GROUP BY s.student_id ORDER BY SUM(c.credits) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the department for all instructors whose last name ends with 'son' to 'Humanities'.
sql_query: UPDATE instructors SET department = 'Humanities' WHERE last_name LIKE '%son';

natural_language_query: List all courses that are taken by students from every major.
sql_query: SELECT c.course_name FROM courses c JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id JOIN students s ON e.student_id = s.student_id GROUP BY c.course_id HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT s.major) = (SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT major) FROM students);

natural_language_query: Add a new instructor 'Galileo' to the 'Astronomy' department.
sql_query: INSERT INTO instructors (first_name, last_name, department) VALUES ('Galileo', '', 'Astronomy');

natural_language_query: How many students have a double letter in their last name?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM students WHERE last_name GLOB '*[a-z][a-z]*' AND REPLACE(last_name, SUBSTR(last_name, 1, 1), '') LIKE '%' || SUBSTR(last_name, 1, 1) || '%';

natural_language_query: Delete all enrollments for courses that no longer exist in the courses table.
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE course_id NOT IN (SELECT course_id FROM courses);

natural_language_query: Find the department with the lowest percentage of 'A' grades.
sql_query: SELECT c.department FROM courses c JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id GROUP BY c.department ORDER BY (SUM(CASE WHEN e.grade = 'A' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) * 100.0 / COUNT(*)) ASC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: For all courses, prepend 'COURSE: ' to the course name.
sql_query: UPDATE courses SET course_name = 'COURSE: ' || course_name;

natural_language_query: List all students who are taking at least one course from each 'Science' department.
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name FROM students s WHERE (SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT c.department) FROM courses c JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id WHERE e.student_id = s.student_id AND c.department LIKE '%Science%') = (SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT department) FROM courses WHERE department LIKE '%Science%');

natural_language_query: Add a new student 'Leonardo Fibonacci' with major 'Mathematics' enrolled on '1170-01-01'.
sql_query: INSERT INTO students (first_name, last_name, major, enrollment_date) VALUES ('Leonardo', 'Fibonacci', 'Mathematics', '1170-01-01');

natural_language_query: What is the average number of consonants per instructor's full name?
sql_query: SELECT AVG(LENGTH(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(LOWER(first_name || last_name), 'a', ''), 'e', ''), 'i', ''), 'o', ''), 'u', ''))) FROM instructors;

natural_language_query: Remove all instructors from departments that have fewer than 2 courses.
sql_query: DELETE FROM instructors WHERE department IN (SELECT department FROM courses GROUP BY department HAVING COUNT(*) < 2);

natural_language_query: Find the student who has enrollments in the most consecutive semesters (conceptual).
sql_query: SELECT student_id FROM enrollments GROUP BY student_id ORDER BY COUNT(DISTINCT semester) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the major of student 55 to 'Data Analytics'.
sql_query: UPDATE students SET major = 'Data Analytics' WHERE student_id = 55;

natural_language_query: List all courses that have 'Project' in their name.
sql_query: SELECT * FROM courses WHERE course_name LIKE '%Project%';

natural_language_query: Add a new instructor 'J.R.R. Tolkien' to the 'English' department.
sql_query: INSERT INTO instructors (first_name, last_name, department) VALUES ('J.R.R.', 'Tolkien', 'English');

natural_language_query: How many students were enrolled on a Friday?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM students WHERE strftime('%w', enrollment_date) = '5';

natural_language_query: Delete all enrollments that have a grade of 'P' (Pass) from before 2024.
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE grade = 'P' AND semester < '2024';

natural_language_query: Find the major that has the most students with last names starting with 'A'.
sql_query: SELECT major FROM students WHERE last_name LIKE 'A%' GROUP BY major ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Change the credits of all courses in the 'Philosophy' department to 3.
sql_query: UPDATE courses SET credits = 3 WHERE department = 'Philosophy';

natural_language_query: List all instructors who teach a course that student ID 2 is enrolled in.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT i.* FROM instructors i JOIN courses c ON i.department = c.department JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id WHERE e.student_id = 2;

natural_language_query: Add a new student 'Isaac Asimov' with major 'Chemistry' enrolled on '1939-01-01'.
sql_query: INSERT INTO students (first_name, last_name, major, enrollment_date) VALUES ('Isaac', 'Asimov', 'Chemistry', '1939-01-01');

natural_language_query: What is the average number of students in a department?
sql_query: SELECT AVG(student_count) FROM (SELECT COUNT(*) as student_count FROM students GROUP BY major);

natural_language_query: Remove any student whose first name is 'Test'.
sql_query: DELETE FROM students WHERE first_name = 'Test';

natural_language_query: Find the course with the most consistent grades (lowest standard deviation).
sql_query: SELECT c.course_name FROM courses c JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id GROUP BY c.course_id ORDER BY STDEV(e.grade) ASC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update all 'Business' majors' last names to be suffixed with ', MBA'.
sql_query: UPDATE students SET last_name = last_name || ', MBA' WHERE major = 'Business';

natural_language_query: List all students who are taking courses in both the 'Art' and 'Business' departments.
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name FROM students s WHERE EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM enrollments e JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id WHERE e.student_id = s.student_id AND c.department = 'Art') AND EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM enrollments e JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id WHERE e.student_id = s.student_id AND c.department = 'Business');

natural_language_query: Add a new course 'Behavioral Economics' to the 'Economics' department with 3 credits.
sql_query: INSERT INTO courses (course_name, department, credits) VALUES ('Behavioral Economics', 'Economics', 3);

natural_language_query: How many instructors have a first name that is a title (e.g., Dr, Prof)?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM instructors WHERE first_name IN ('Dr', 'Prof');

natural_language_query: Delete all enrollments for student 'Jessica Chen'.
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE student_id = (SELECT student_id FROM students WHERE first_name = 'Jessica' AND last_name = 'Chen');

natural_language_query: Find the department where the average instructor last name is the shortest.
sql_query: SELECT department FROM instructors GROUP BY department ORDER BY AVG(LENGTH(last_name)) ASC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Swap the departments of instructor 3 and instructor 4.
sql_query: UPDATE instructors SET department = CASE instructor_id WHEN 3 THEN (SELECT department FROM instructors WHERE instructor_id = 4) WHEN 4 THEN (SELECT department FROM instructors WHERE instructor_id = 3) END WHERE instructor_id IN (3, 4);

natural_language_query: List all courses that have enrollments from at least 5 different majors.
sql_query: SELECT c.course_name FROM courses c JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id JOIN students s ON e.student_id = s.student_id GROUP BY c.course_id HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT s.major) >= 5;

natural_language_query: Add a new student 'Sun Tzu' with major 'Military Science' enrolled on '-0500-01-01'.
sql_query: INSERT INTO students (first_name, last_name, major, enrollment_date) VALUES ('Sun', 'Tzu', 'Military Science', '-0500-01-01');

natural_language_query: What is the total credit load for each instructor's department?
sql_query: SELECT i.department, SUM(c.credits) FROM instructors i JOIN courses c ON i.department = c.department GROUP BY i.department;

natural_language_query: Remove any courses that have had no enrollments for 2 consecutive years.
sql_query: DELETE FROM courses WHERE course_id NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT course_id FROM enrollments WHERE semester >= '2023');

natural_language_query: Find the student who is enrolled in the most courses with 'Lab' in the name.
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id WHERE c.course_name LIKE '%Lab%' GROUP BY s.student_id ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Add a new student 'Daniel Kim' with major 'Finance' enrolled on '2022-08-20'
sql_query: INSERT INTO students (first_name, last_name, major, 'enrollment_date') VALUES ('Daniel', 'Kim', 'Finance', '2022-08-20');

natural_language_query: What is the most common first name for an instructor?
sql_query: SELECT first_name FROM instructors GROUP BY first_name ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Remove all students whose last name is less than 5 characters long
sql_query: DELETE FROM students WHERE LENGTH(last_name) < 5;

natural_language_query: Find the student who has the highest average grade
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id GROUP BY s.student_id ORDER BY AVG(e.grade) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the credits for all courses to be at least 3
sql_query: UPDATE courses SET credits = 3 WHERE credits < 3;

natural_language_query: List all students who enrolled in 2023
sql_query: SELECT * FROM students WHERE strftime('%Y', enrollment_date) = '2023';

natural_language_query: Enroll every student from the 'Physics' major into the 'Safety Training' course (ID 999) for 'Fall 2024'
sql_query: INSERT INTO enrollments (student_id, course_id, semester) SELECT student_id, 999, 'Fall 2024' FROM students WHERE major = 'Physics';

natural_language_query: How many courses does the average instructor's department offer?
sql_query: SELECT AVG(course_count) FROM (SELECT COUNT(*) as course_count FROM courses GROUP BY department);

natural_language_query: Delete all enrollments for students who are no longer in the students table
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE student_id NOT IN (SELECT student_id FROM students);

natural_language_query: Find all courses that have enrollments in both 'Fall 2023' and 'Spring 2024' semesters
sql_query: SELECT c.course_name FROM courses c JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id WHERE e.semester = 'Fall 2023' AND c.course_id IN (SELECT course_id FROM enrollments WHERE semester = 'Spring 2024');

natural_language_query: Change the last name for all instructors in the 'Art' department to 'Artist'
sql_query: UPDATE instructors SET last_name = 'Artist' WHERE department = 'Art';

natural_language_query: List all students who share a major with at least one instructor's department
sql_query: SELECT s.* FROM students s WHERE s.major IN (SELECT DISTINCT i.department FROM instructors i);

natural_language_query: Add a new course 'Advanced Algorithms' with 4 credits to the 'Computer Science' department
sql_query: INSERT INTO courses (course_name, department, credits) VALUES ('Advanced Algorithms', 'Computer Science', 4);

natural_language_query: What percentage of students have an 'A' grade in at least one course?
sql_query: SELECT (COUNT(DISTINCT student_id) * 100.0 / (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM students)) FROM enrollments WHERE grade = 'A';

natural_language_query: Remove all students who have no enrollments
sql_query: DELETE FROM students WHERE student_id NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT student_id FROM enrollments);

natural_language_query: Find the department that has the highest average student enrollment per course
sql_query: SELECT c.department FROM courses c JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id GROUP BY c.department ORDER BY COUNT(DISTINCT e.student_id) / COUNT(DISTINCT c.course_id) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the grades for enrollments in 'Calculus I' to 'A' for students who are 'Mathematics' majors
sql_query: UPDATE enrollments SET grade = 'A' WHERE course_id = (SELECT course_id FROM courses WHERE course_name = 'Calculus I') AND student_id IN (SELECT student_id FROM students WHERE major = 'Mathematics');

natural_language_query: List the names of students who are taking all courses offered by the 'Physics' department
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name FROM students s WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT c.course_id FROM courses c WHERE c.department = 'Physics' AND NOT EXISTS (SELECT e.enrollment_id FROM enrollments e WHERE e.student_id = s.student_id AND e.course_id = c.course_id));

natural_language_query: Add a new instructor 'Noam Chomsky' to the 'Linguistics' department
sql_query: INSERT INTO instructors (first_name, last_name, department) VALUES ('Noam', 'Chomsky', 'Linguistics');

natural_language_query: How many students enrolled on the first day of any month?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM students WHERE strftime('%d', enrollment_date) = '01';

natural_language_query: Delete all courses that have never been offered in a 'Fall' semester
sql_query: DELETE FROM courses WHERE course_id NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT course_id FROM enrollments WHERE semester LIKE 'Fall %');

natural_language_query: Find the student with the most diverse set of courses (i.e., courses from the most departments)
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id GROUP BY s.student_id ORDER BY COUNT(DISTINCT c.department) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Change the major of students to 'Interdisciplinary Studies' if they are enrolled in courses from 3 or more different departments
sql_query: UPDATE students SET major = 'Interdisciplinary Studies' WHERE student_id IN (SELECT e.student_id FROM enrollments e JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id GROUP BY e.student_id HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT c.department) >= 3);

natural_language_query: List all pairs of students who are in the same major
sql_query: SELECT s1.first_name, s1.last_name, s2.first_name, s2.last_name, s1.major FROM students s1 JOIN students s2 ON s1.major = s2.major AND s1.student_id < s2.student_id;

natural_language_query: Add a new enrollment for student 50 in course 101 for 'Spring 2025'
sql_query: INSERT INTO enrollments (student_id, course_id, semester) VALUES (50, 101, 'Spring 2025');

natural_language_query: What is the distribution of grades across all enrollments?
sql_query: SELECT grade, COUNT(*) FROM enrollments GROUP BY grade;

natural_language_query: Remove all instructors who are not associated with any courses in their department
sql_query: DELETE FROM instructors i WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM courses c WHERE c.department = i.department);

natural_language_query: Find the toughest course, defined as the one with the lowest average grade
sql_query: SELECT c.course_name FROM courses c JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id GROUP BY c.course_id ORDER BY AVG(e.grade) ASC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the last name of student 33 to 'Smith-Jones'
sql_query: UPDATE students SET last_name = 'Smith-Jones' WHERE student_id = 33;

natural_language_query: List all students who are taking at least one course from every department
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name FROM students s WHERE (SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT c.department) FROM courses c JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id WHERE e.student_id = s.student_id) = (SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT department) FROM departments);

natural_language_query: Create a new 'Music' department and add an instructor 'Mozart' to it
sql_query: INSERT INTO instructors (first_name, last_name, department) VALUES ('Wolfgang', 'Mozart', 'Music');

natural_language_query: How many characters is the longest course name?
sql_query: SELECT MAX(LENGTH(course_name)) FROM courses;

natural_language_query: Delete all enrollments for students whose first name is 'John'
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE student_id IN (SELECT student_id FROM students WHERE first_name = 'John');

natural_language_query: Find the 'loneliest' student, who shares a major with the fewest other students
sql_query: SELECT s1.first_name, s1.last_name FROM students s1 JOIN students s2 ON s1.major = s2.major GROUP BY s1.student_id ORDER BY COUNT(s2.student_id) ASC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Promote all 3-credit courses in the 'English' department to 4 credits
sql_query: UPDATE courses SET credits = 4 WHERE department = 'English' AND credits = 3;

natural_language_query: List all students who have a perfect record of only 'A' grades
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name FROM students s WHERE s.student_id NOT IN (SELECT e.student_id FROM enrollments e WHERE e.grade != 'A') AND s.student_id IN (SELECT student_id FROM enrollments);

natural_language_query: Add a new student 'Isabella Rossi' majoring in 'International Relations' enrolled today
sql_query: INSERT INTO students (first_name, last_name, major, enrollment_date) VALUES ('Isabella', 'Rossi', 'International Relations', '2025-07-27');

natural_language_query: What's the student-to-instructor ratio for the 'Computer Science' department?
sql_query: SELECT (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM students WHERE major = 'Computer Science') * 1.0 / (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM instructors WHERE department = 'Computer Science');

natural_language_query: Remove any course that has 'Beginner' in its title
sql_query: DELETE FROM courses WHERE course_name LIKE '%Beginner%';

natural_language_query: Find the student(s) who enrolled on the same day as 'John Smith'
sql_query: SELECT * FROM students WHERE enrollment_date = (SELECT enrollment_date FROM students WHERE first_name = 'John' AND last_name = 'Smith') AND (first_name != 'John' OR last_name != 'Smith');

natural_language_query: Update all null grades to 'I' for Incomplete
sql_query: UPDATE enrollments SET grade = 'I' WHERE grade IS NULL;

natural_language_query: List all instructors who teach in a department that has 'Science' in its name
sql_query: SELECT * FROM instructors WHERE department LIKE '%Science%';

natural_language_query: Add a new enrollment for student 1 for every course in the 'Mathematics' department for 'Fall 2025'
sql_query: INSERT INTO enrollments (student_id, course_id, semester) SELECT 1, course_id, 'Fall 2025' FROM courses WHERE department = 'Mathematics';

natural_language_query: How many students have a palindrome for a first name?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM students WHERE first_name = REVERSE(first_name);

natural_language_query: Delete all enrollments from the 13th of any month
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE strftime('%d', '2000-01-01') = '13';

natural_language_query: Find the department with the longest average course name
sql_query: SELECT department FROM courses GROUP BY department ORDER BY AVG(LENGTH(course_name)) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Switch the majors of student 10 and student 20
sql_query: UPDATE students SET major = (SELECT major FROM students WHERE student_id = 20) WHERE student_id = 10;

natural_language_query: List all students who are not taking any 4-credit courses
sql_query: SELECT * FROM students s WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM enrollments e JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id WHERE e.student_id = s.student_id AND c.credits = 4);

natural_language_query: Add a new instructor 'Galileo Galilei' to the 'Astronomy' department
sql_query: INSERT INTO instructors (first_name, last_name, department) VALUES ('Galileo', 'Galilei', 'Astronomy');

natural_language_query: What is the total number of credit hours being taken by all students in 'Spring 2024'?
sql_query: SELECT SUM(c.credits) FROM courses c JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id WHERE e.semester = 'Spring 2024';

natural_language_query: Delete any student who has 'temp' in their last name
sql_query: DELETE FROM students WHERE last_name LIKE '%temp%';

natural_language_query: Find the instructor who teaches the most courses (based on department)
sql_query: SELECT i.first_name, i.last_name FROM instructors i JOIN courses c ON i.department = c.department GROUP BY i.instructor_id ORDER BY COUNT(c.course_id) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the enrollment date for all 'Physics' majors to one year earlier
sql_query: UPDATE students SET enrollment_date = date(enrollment_date, '-1 year') WHERE major = 'Physics';

natural_language_query: List all courses that have no instructor in their department
sql_query: SELECT * FROM courses c WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM instructors i WHERE i.department = c.department);

natural_language_query: Add a new student 'Ken Thompson' with major 'Computer Science' enrolled on '1969-01-01'
sql_query: INSERT INTO students (first_name, last_name, major, enrollment_date) VALUES ('Ken', 'Thompson', 'Computer Science', '1969-01-01');

natural_language_query: How many enrollments have a grade of 'A' or 'A+'?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM enrollments WHERE grade IN ('A', 'A+');

natural_language_query: Delete all enrollments that are more than 5 years old
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE semester < '2020-07-27';

natural_language_query: Find the students who have taken both 'Data Structures' and 'Algorithms'
sql_query: SELECT s.* FROM students s JOIN enrollments e1 ON s.student_id = e1.student_id JOIN courses c1 ON e1.course_id = c1.course_id JOIN enrollments e2 ON s.student_id = e2.student_id JOIN courses c2 ON e2.course_id = c2.course_id WHERE c1.course_name = 'Data Structures' AND c2.course_name = 'Algorithms';

natural_language_query: Change the department of all instructors named 'John' to 'General Studies'
sql_query: UPDATE instructors SET department = 'General Studies' WHERE first_name = 'John';

natural_language_query: List the student who has been enrolled the longest
sql_query: SELECT * FROM students ORDER BY enrollment_date ASC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Add a new course 'Existentialism' with 3 credits to the 'Philosophy' department
sql_query: INSERT INTO courses (course_name, department, credits) VALUES ('Existentialism', 'Philosophy', 3);

natural_language_query: What is the average length of a student's last name?
sql_query: SELECT AVG(LENGTH(last_name)) FROM students;

natural_language_query: Remove any student with an ID greater than 500
sql_query: DELETE FROM students WHERE student_id > 500;

natural_language_query: Find the courses that are prerequisites for 'Advanced Databases' (conceptual)
sql_query: SELECT prerequisite_course_name FROM prerequisites WHERE course_name = 'Advanced Databases';

natural_language_query: Update the grades of all 'History' majors in 'World History' to be one letter grade higher (conceptual)
sql_query: UPDATE enrollments SET grade = 'A' WHERE grade = 'B' AND course_id = (SELECT course_id FROM courses WHERE course_name = 'World History') AND student_id IN (SELECT student_id FROM students WHERE major = 'History');

natural_language_query: List all students and the count of courses they are currently enrolled in for 'Fall 2024'
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name, COUNT(e.course_id) FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id WHERE e.semester = 'Fall 2024' GROUP BY s.student_id;

natural_language_query: Add a new instructor 'Ada Lovelace' to the 'Computer Science' department
sql_query: INSERT INTO instructors (first_name, last_name, department) VALUES ('Ada', 'Lovelace', 'Computer Science');

natural_language_query: How many students have the same first name as an instructor?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT s.student_id) FROM students s JOIN instructors i ON s.first_name = i.first_name;

natural_language_query: Delete all courses with no enrollments in the last 2 years
sql_query: DELETE FROM courses WHERE course_id NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT course_id FROM enrollments WHERE semester > '2023-07-27');

natural_language_query: Find the major with the highest average grade
sql_query: SELECT s.major FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id GROUP BY s.major ORDER BY AVG(e.grade) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Double the credits for all courses in the 'Fine Arts' department
sql_query: UPDATE courses SET credits = credits * 2 WHERE department = 'Fine Arts';

natural_language_query: List all students who are only enrolled in courses from their own major's department
sql_query: SELECT s.* FROM students s WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM enrollments e JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id WHERE e.student_id = s.student_id AND c.department != s.major);

natural_language_query: Add a new student 'Grace Hopper' with major 'Computer Science' enrolled on '1943-12-01'
sql_query: INSERT INTO students (first_name, last_name, major, enrollment_date) VALUES ('Grace', 'Hopper', 'Computer Science', '1943-12-01');

natural_language_query: What is the total number of students whose first name starts with a vowel?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM students WHERE SUBSTR(first_name, 1, 1) IN ('A', 'E', 'I', 'O', 'U');

natural_language_query: Remove all enrollments from students majoring in 'Economics'
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE student_id IN (SELECT student_id FROM students WHERE major = 'Economics');

natural_language_query: Find the instructor who teaches in the department with the fewest students
sql_query: SELECT i.* FROM instructors i WHERE i.department = (SELECT s.major FROM students s GROUP BY s.major ORDER BY COUNT(s.student_id) ASC LIMIT 1);

natural_language_query: Update the semester for all of student 2's enrollments to 'Medical Leave'
sql_query: UPDATE enrollments SET semester = 'Medical Leave' WHERE student_id = 2;

natural_language_query: List all courses and the number of different majors enrolled in each
sql_query: SELECT c.course_name, COUNT(DISTINCT s.major) FROM courses c JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id JOIN students s ON e.student_id = s.student_id GROUP BY c.course_id;

natural_language_query: Add a 1-credit 'Lab Safety' course to the 'Chemistry' department
sql_query: INSERT INTO courses (course_name, department, credits) VALUES ('Lab Safety', 'Chemistry', 1);

natural_language_query: How many students have a last name that is also a common English word (conceptual)?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM students WHERE last_name IN ('Baker', 'Cook', 'Smith', 'Jones', 'Hill');

natural_language_query: Delete all students who enrolled on a weekend
sql_query: DELETE FROM students WHERE strftime('%w', enrollment_date) IN ('0', '6');

natural_language_query: Find the easiest department, defined by the highest average grade
sql_query: SELECT c.department FROM courses c JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id GROUP BY c.department ORDER BY AVG(e.grade) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Give a 5% credit bonus (conceptual) to all courses in the 'Engineering' department
sql_query: UPDATE courses SET credits = credits * 1.05 WHERE department = 'Engineering';

natural_language_query: List all students who are taking more than 15 credits in the current semester ('Fall 2024')
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id WHERE e.semester = 'Fall 2024' GROUP BY s.student_id HAVING SUM(c.credits) > 15;

natural_language_query: Add a new student 'Srinivasa Ramanujan' with major 'Mathematics' enrolled on '1914-04-17'
sql_query: INSERT INTO students (first_name, last_name, major, enrollment_date) VALUES ('Srinivasa', 'Ramanujan', 'Mathematics', '1914-04-17');

natural_language_query: What is the ratio of students to courses?
sql_query: SELECT (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM students) * 1.0 / (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM courses);

natural_language_query: Remove all enrollments for courses that have 'Intro' in the name
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE course_id IN (SELECT course_id FROM courses WHERE course_name LIKE '%Intro%');

natural_language_query: Find pairs of instructors who are in the same department
sql_query: SELECT i1.first_name, i1.last_name, i2.first_name, i2.last_name, i1.department FROM instructors i1 JOIN instructors i2 ON i1.department = i2.department AND i1.instructor_id < i2.instructor_id;

natural_language_query: Update the enrollment date of student 40 to be the first of the month
sql_query: UPDATE students SET enrollment_date = date(enrollment_date, 'start of month') WHERE student_id = 40;

natural_language_query: List all courses that are cross-listed in more than one department (conceptual)
sql_query: SELECT course_name FROM cross_listings GROUP BY course_name HAVING COUNT(department) > 1;

natural_language_query: Add a new instructor 'Hypatia' to the 'Mathematics' department
sql_query: INSERT INTO instructors (first_name, last_name, department) VALUES ('Hypatia', '', 'Mathematics');

natural_language_query: How many students were enrolled per month in 2023?
sql_query: SELECT strftime('%m', enrollment_date) as month, COUNT(*) FROM students WHERE strftime('%Y', enrollment_date) = '2023' GROUP BY month;

natural_language_query: Delete all grades that are not 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'F', or 'P'
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE grade NOT IN ('A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'F', 'P');

natural_language_query: Find the student with the most 'A' grades
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id WHERE e.grade = 'A' GROUP BY s.student_id ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Change the department of 'Classical Physics' to 'Physics and Astronomy'
sql_query: UPDATE courses SET department = 'Physics and Astronomy' WHERE course_name = 'Classical Physics';

natural_language_query: List all students whose major department has fewer than 3 instructors
sql_query: SELECT s.* FROM students s WHERE s.major IN (SELECT department FROM instructors GROUP BY department HAVING COUNT(*) < 3);

natural_language_query: Add a new student, 'Leonardo da Vinci', with major 'Art & Science', enrolled in 1472.
sql_query: INSERT INTO students (first_name, last_name, major, enrollment_date) VALUES ('Leonardo', 'da Vinci', 'Art & Science', '1472-01-01');

natural_language_query: What is the average number of courses per department?
sql_query: SELECT AVG(course_count) FROM (SELECT COUNT(*) as course_count FROM courses GROUP BY department);

natural_language_query: Archive (delete) all enrollments from before 2020
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE semester < '2020';

natural_language_query: Find the instructor who teaches the course with the highest enrollment
sql_query: SELECT i.* FROM instructors i JOIN courses c ON i.department = c.department JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id GROUP BY e.course_id ORDER BY COUNT(e.student_id) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the last name of all students named 'Chris' to 'Christopher'
sql_query: UPDATE students SET first_name = 'Christopher' WHERE first_name = 'Chris';

natural_language_query: List all courses that have a student and an instructor with the same last name enrolled/teaching
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT c.course_name FROM courses c JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id JOIN students s ON e.student_id = s.student_id JOIN instructors i ON c.department = i.department WHERE s.last_name = i.last_name;

natural_language_query: Add a new course 'Bioethics' to the 'Philosophy' department with 3 credits
sql_query: INSERT INTO courses (course_name, department, credits) VALUES ('Bioethics', 'Philosophy', 3);

natural_language_query: How many students have a last name with more than 10 letters?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM students WHERE LENGTH(last_name) > 10;

natural_language_query: Delete all students who have not been enrolled in any course for the last 2 years
sql_query: DELETE FROM students WHERE student_id NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT student_id FROM enrollments WHERE semester >= '2023-07-27');

natural_language_query: Find the major with the smallest range of grades (conceptual)
sql_query: SELECT s.major FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id GROUP BY s.major ORDER BY (MAX(e.grade) - MIN(e.grade)) ASC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Standardize department names to be Title Case (conceptual)
sql_query: UPDATE courses SET department = INITCAP(department);

natural_language_query: List all students who are taking a course outside of their major and have a grade of 'C' or lower in it
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT s.* FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id WHERE s.major != c.department AND e.grade IN ('C', 'D', 'F');

natural_language_query: Add a new student 'Nikola Tesla' with major 'Electrical Engineering' enrolled on '1875-01-01'
sql_query: INSERT INTO students (first_name, last_name, major, enrollment_date) VALUES ('Nikola', 'Tesla', 'Electrical Engineering', '1875-01-01');

natural_language_query: What is the most common day of the week for enrollments?
sql_query: SELECT strftime('%w', enrollment_date) as day, COUNT(*) as count FROM students GROUP BY day ORDER BY count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Remove all 1-credit courses
sql_query: DELETE FROM courses WHERE credits = 1;

natural_language_query: Find the student who is enrolled in courses with the highest total number of credits for 'Fall 2024'
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id WHERE e.semester = 'Fall 2024' GROUP BY s.student_id ORDER BY SUM(c.credits) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the department for all instructors whose first name starts with 'A' to 'Academics'
sql_query: UPDATE instructors SET department = 'Academics' WHERE first_name LIKE 'A%';

natural_language_query: List all courses that are only taken by students from one major
sql_query: SELECT c.course_name FROM courses c JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id JOIN students s ON e.student_id = s.student_id GROUP BY c.course_id HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT s.major) = 1;

natural_language_query: Add a new instructor 'Carl Sagan' to the 'Astronomy' department
sql_query: INSERT INTO instructors (first_name, last_name, department) VALUES ('Carl', 'Sagan', 'Astronomy');

natural_language_query: How many students have a hyphen in their last name?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM students WHERE last_name LIKE '%-%';

natural_language_query: Delete all enrollments for courses that have been deleted from the courses table
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE course_id NOT IN (SELECT course_id FROM courses);

natural_language_query: Find the department with the highest percentage of 'A' grades
sql_query: SELECT c.department FROM courses c JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id GROUP BY c.department ORDER BY (SUM(CASE WHEN e.grade = 'A' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) * 100.0 / COUNT(*)) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: For all courses, append '(Undergraduate)' to the course name if the course ID is below 500
sql_query: UPDATE courses SET course_name = course_name || ' (Undergraduate)' WHERE course_id < 500;

natural_language_query: List all students who are taking at least one course with every instructor in the 'Physics' department
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name FROM students s WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT i.instructor_id FROM instructors i WHERE i.department = 'Physics' AND NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM enrollments e JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id WHERE e.student_id = s.student_id AND c.department = i.department));

natural_language_query: Add a new student 'Jane Goodall' with major 'Anthropology' enrolled on '1960-07-14'
sql_query: INSERT INTO students (first_name, last_name, major, enrollment_date) VALUES ('Jane', 'Goodall', 'Anthropology', '1960-07-14');

natural_language_query: What is the average number of vowels per student's full name?
sql_query: SELECT AVG(LENGTH(first_name || last_name) - LENGTH(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(LOWER(first_name || last_name), 'a', ''), 'e', ''), 'i', ''), 'o', ''), 'u', ''))) FROM students;

natural_language_query: Remove all instructors from departments that have no students
sql_query: DELETE FROM instructors WHERE department NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT major FROM students);

natural_language_query: Find the student who has the most enrollments in a single semester
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name, e.semester, COUNT(*) as enrollment_count FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id GROUP BY s.student_id, e.semester ORDER BY enrollment_count DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the major of student 50 to 'Cognitive Science'
sql_query: UPDATE students SET major = 'Cognitive Science' WHERE student_id = 50;

natural_language_query: List all courses that have 'Lab' in their name but are worth more than 1 credit
sql_query: SELECT * FROM courses WHERE course_name LIKE '%Lab%' AND credits > 1;

natural_language_query: Add a new instructor 'Richard Feynman' to the 'Physics' department
sql_query: INSERT INTO instructors (first_name, last_name, department) VALUES ('Richard', 'Feynman', 'Physics');

natural_language_query: How many students were enrolled on a Monday?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM students WHERE strftime('%w', enrollment_date) = '1';

natural_language_query: Delete all enrollments that have a grade of 'I' (Incomplete) and are from before 2023
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE grade = 'I' AND semester < '2023';

natural_language_query: Find the major that has the most diverse last names
sql_query: SELECT s.major FROM students s GROUP BY s.major ORDER BY COUNT(DISTINCT s.last_name) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Change the credits of all courses in the 'Computer Science' department to be 3 if they are currently 4
sql_query: UPDATE courses SET credits = 3 WHERE department = 'Computer Science' AND credits = 4;

natural_language_query: List all instructors who teach a course that student ID 1 is enrolled in
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT i.* FROM instructors i JOIN courses c ON i.department = c.department JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id WHERE e.student_id = 1;

natural_language_query: Add a new student 'Max Planck' with major 'Physics' enrolled on '1874-10-21'
sql_query: INSERT INTO students (first_name, last_name, major, enrollment_date) VALUES ('Max', 'Planck', 'Physics', '1874-10-21');

natural_language_query: What is the average number of instructors per department?
sql_query: SELECT AVG(instructor_count) FROM (SELECT COUNT(*) as instructor_count FROM instructors GROUP BY department);

natural_language_query: Remove any student whose first and last names are the same
sql_query: DELETE FROM students WHERE first_name = last_name;

natural_language_query: Find the course with the widest grade distribution (conceptual)
sql_query: SELECT c.course_name FROM courses c JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id GROUP BY c.course_id ORDER BY (COUNT(DISTINCT e.grade)) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update all 'Philosophy' majors' last names to be prefixed with 'Philo-'
sql_query: UPDATE students SET last_name = 'Philo-' || last_name WHERE major = 'Philosophy';

natural_language_query: List all students who are taking courses in at least 3 different departments
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id GROUP BY s.student_id HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT c.department) >= 3;

natural_language_query: Add a new course 'Game Theory' to the 'Economics' department with 3 credits
sql_query: INSERT INTO courses (course_name, department, credits) VALUES ('Game Theory', 'Economics', 3);

natural_language_query: How many students have a Z in their name?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM students WHERE first_name LIKE '%z%' OR last_name LIKE '%z%';

natural_language_query: Delete all enrollments for student 'John Doe'
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE student_id = (SELECT student_id FROM students WHERE first_name = 'John' AND last_name = 'Doe');

natural_language_query: Find the department where the average instructor first name is the longest
sql_query: SELECT department FROM instructors GROUP BY department ORDER BY AVG(LENGTH(first_name)) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Swap the departments of instructor 1 and instructor 2
sql_query: UPDATE instructors SET department = (SELECT department FROM instructors WHERE instructor_id = 2) WHERE instructor_id = 1;

natural_language_query: List all courses that have an enrollment from every student major
sql_query: SELECT c.course_name FROM courses c WHERE (SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT s.major) FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id WHERE e.course_id = c.course_id) = (SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT major) FROM students);

natural_language_query: Add a new student 'Rachel Carson' with major 'Biology' enrolled on '1929-09-01'
sql_query: INSERT INTO students (first_name, last_name, major, enrollment_date) VALUES ('Rachel', 'Carson', 'Biology', '1929-09-01');

natural_language_query: What is the total credit load for each student for the 'Spring 2024' semester?
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name, SUM(c.credits) as total_credits FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id WHERE e.semester = 'Spring 2024' GROUP BY s.student_id;

natural_language_query: Remove any courses that have not had any enrollments
sql_query: DELETE FROM courses WHERE course_id NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT course_id FROM enrollments);

natural_language_query: Find the student who is enrolled in the most 3-credit courses
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id WHERE c.credits = 3 GROUP BY s.student_id ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Update the last name of student 101 to 'Johnson'
sql_query: UPDATE students SET last_name = 'Johnson' WHERE student_id = 101;

natural_language_query: List all instructors who are in a department that offers a 5-credit course
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT i.* FROM instructors i JOIN courses c ON i.department = c.department WHERE c.credits = 5;

sql_query: INSERT INTO courses (course_name, department, credits) VALUES ('Intro to Global Politics', 'Political Science', 3);

natural_language_query: Delete all enrollments for student 12.
sql_query: DELETE FROM enrollments WHERE student_id = 12;

natural_language_query: Find the major with the highest number of students enrolled before 2022.
sql_query: SELECT major FROM students WHERE enrollment_date < '2022-01-01' GROUP BY major ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: List all students and instructors in the 'Physics' department/major.

natural_language_query: Add a new enrollment for student 60 in course 301 for 'Fall 2025'.

natural_language_query: How many courses have no department listed?

natural_language_query: Delete instructor 101.
sql_query: DELETE FROM instructors WHERE instructor_id = 101;

natural_language_query: Find the major with the most 'A' grades.
sql_query: SELECT s.major FROM students s JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id WHERE e.grade = 'A' GROUP BY s.major ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

natural_language_query: Find all students and instructors who are in the same department/major.
sql_query: SELECT s.first_name, s.last_name, 'Student' as role FROM students s WHERE s.major IN (SELECT department FROM instructors) UNION SELECT i.first_name, i.last_name, 'Instructor' as role FROM instructors i WHERE i.department IN (SELECT major FROM students);

sql_query: INSERT INTO courses (course_name, course_code, credits, department) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?);

natural_language_query: Add a new professor. Please enter: first name, last name, email, department, and salary.
sql_query: INSERT INTO professors (first_name, last_name, email, department, salary) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?);

natural_language_query: Update a student's major. Please enter: student ID and new major.
sql_query: UPDATE students SET major = ? WHERE student_id = ?;

natural_language_query: Update a professor's salary. Please enter: professor ID and new salary.
sql_query: UPDATE professors SET salary = ? WHERE professor_id = ?;

natural_language_query: Update course
sql_query: UPDATE courses SET credits = ? WHERE course_id = ?;

natural_language_query: Delete student.
sql_query: DELETE FROM students WHERE student_id = ?;

natural_language_query: Delete course.
sql_query: DELETE FROM courses WHERE course_id = ?;

natural_language_query: Delete teacher.
sql_query: DELETE FROM professors WHERE professor_id = ?;
